job_description: Position Overview: As a Full Stack Developer at Opstech, you will play a crucial role in the end-to-end development of web applications and mobile applications. You will be responsible for designing, implementing, testing, and maintaining scalable, high-performance software solutions. Your expertise in React and Node.js will be instrumental in creating seamless and responsive user interfaces. Additionally, your experience with Kafka and AWS will be crucial in designing and implementing scalable, distributed, and cloud-native solutions. Key Responsibilities: Develop and maintain robust and scalable web applications using React for the frontend and Node.js for the backend. Integrate Kafka for real-time event streaming, ensuring seamless communication between microservices. Implement serverless and cloud-native solutions on AWS, leveraging services like Lambda, API Gateway, S3, and more. Design and implement efficient, reusable, and reliable code following best practices. Ensure the responsiveness and performance of applications across various devices and browsers. Debug and resolve issues in a timely manner, ensuring the stability and reliability of the applications. Stay updated on industry trends and emerging technologies, actively contributing to the continuous improvement of development processes. Qualifications: Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field. Proven 3-5 years of experience as a Full Stack Developer with a focus on React, Node.js, Kafka, and AWS. Strong proficiency in JavaScript and its modern frameworks (React). Experience with server-side development using Node.js and related frameworks (Express, etc.). Knowledge of event-driven architecture and experience with Apache Kafka. (PTO) Hands-on experience with AWS services and infrastructure as code (CloudFormation, Terraform). Familiarity with database systems such as MongoDB, MySQL, or PostgreSQL. Understanding of RESTful APIs and microservices architecture. Knowledge of version control systems, preferably Git and Bitbucket Excellent problem-solving and communication skills. Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a team environment. Additional good to have skills Experience with containerization technologies (Docker, Kubernetes). Knowledge of state management libraries (Redux, MobX). Familiarity with build tools and package managers (Webpack, npm). Understanding of CI/CD pipelines. Front-end technologies such as HTML5, CSS3, and responsive design principles.

job_description:
NXP’s Wireless Connectivity DSP team plays a pivotal role in shaping the system-level performance and optimization of next-generation WLAN and Narrowband (Bluetooth and IEEE 802.15.4) transceivers. This team drives PHY algorithm development, digital verification, silicon bring-up and cross-layer tuning for NXP’s connectivity solutions. Additionally, the team develops machine learning based algorithms for advanced wireless applications.

 

Key Responsibilities:

  • Deploy concepts from wireless communications theory and machine learning to design cutting-edge algorithms for Wi-Fi and narrowband transceivers
  • Develop tools/software using C/C++/Python/MATLAB to build detailed system models and perform complex system simulations/analysis to characterize PHY performance
  • Collaborate with design engineers to develop area/power efficient hardware implementations and assist in verification efforts
  • Devise and construct experiments to test silicon performance in cabled and OTA environments post-tapeout with respect to PHY layer metrics
  • Evaluate results from silicon bring-up, root-cause deficiencies, and develop improvements to design wherever applicable

 

Qualifications:

  • M.S./M.Tech/Ph.D in Electrical or Computer Engineering with a focus on wireless communications, signal processing or applied machine learning for wireless
  • Strong analytical and debugging skills, with effective communication abilities
  • Experience with wireless standards (e.g., IEEE 802.11, Bluetooth, IEEE 802.15.4, LTE, mmWave), hands-on use of RF test equipment (such as VSA/VSG), and/or familiarity with embedded machine learning frameworks and platforms (TensorFlow/PyTorch) highly desirable.
  • Proficiency in Linux and scripting languages
  • A progressive mindset with a focus on continuous improvement and innovation

We are looking for individuals who want to make a career in Analytics, Data Science & New Age Technology. If you are passionate about Analytics and want to make an impact by challenging yourself, this is what the role entails:

 

·      Data & Analytics

o  Collect, clean, and integrate commercial and healthcare data (e.g., sales, prescription, claims, patient-level).

o  Conduct descriptive and exploratory analyses to identify key patterns and trends

o  Develop dashboards and visualizations using BI tools (Tableau, Power BI).

·      Advanced Analytics & Data Science

o  Apply statistical methods and machine learning techniques (regression, clustering, forecasting, classification).

o  Support variety of business problems across forecasting, customer segmentation, marketing mix, patient analytics domains using advanced analytics.

o  Develop ML models using state-of-the-art classical algorithms and Deep Learning approaches.

o  Build and maintain GenAI / Agentic AI applications.



·      ML Ops & Engineering

o  Support in ML Engineering / MLOps: model deployment, monitoring, retraining pipelines, and CI/CD practices.

o  Work with modern tech stacks (Python, PySpark, Databricks, SQL, TensorFlow/PyTorch, cloud platforms).

o  Apply Agile methodologies to deliver iterative and high-quality analytics solutions.

o  Contribute to automation, process improvement, documentation, and building reusable knowledge assets

o  Contribute to SDLC processes including design reviews, code reviews, deployment planning, and testing

·      Business Insights & Delivery

o  Translate analytical outputs into clear business implications for clients.

o  Work closely with onshore teams and product managers for enhancements and client-ready insights & recommendations

o  Participate in requirements gathering, propose technology/modeling solutions, and contribute to development within agreed timelines

o  Business consulting on sales consulting and operation areas like territory design, call plan / dynamic targeting design, Incentive compensation design etc. 

 

What We Offer

  • A clear career progression path with opportunities to learn industry best practices and gain exposure to global life sciences operations, which will enable growth towards data analyst, operations lead, or client engagement roles.
  • Opportunity to work on impactful analytics and data science projects for leading global pharma clients.
  • Structured training across data analytics, data science, and pharma domain knowledge.
  • Mentorship and career development opportunities within a collaborative environment.
  • Exposure to AI/GenAI-enabled delivery models, shaping the future of healthcare analytics.

Employment (Placement) Tracks:-

1. Engineering Impact Track (EIT)

This track is designed for students with strong fundamentals who show high potential but may need additional time, mentorship, and structured learning to ramp up.

What EIT offers:

  • High-quality, in-depth technical mentorship

  • Time to build expertise on our tech stack

  • Opportunity to work on key modules with senior engineers

  • A growth path that allows transition into leadership roles based on performance

EIT focuses on skill-building, strong execution, and becoming a high-impact contributor.

2. Engineering Leadership Track (ELT)

This is a fast-track program for students who already demonstrate exceptional technical depth, strong ownership mindset, and leadership readiness during our evaluation process.

Along with higher compensation, ELT comes with higher expectations and broader responsibilities.

What ELT offers (beyond salary):

  • Early ownership of end-to-end modules/features

  • Opportunities to lead smaller pods or projects within the first year itself

  • Higher visibility with the CTO and leadership team

  • Faster promotion bandwidth based purely on delivered outcomes

  • Additional ESOP bracket as part of the long-term leadership pipeline

ELT is meant for candidates who can take on larger responsibilities from Day 1 and influence product direction, not just execute tasks.

Your final track assignment will depend on interview performance, technical depth, problem-solving ability, and leadership potential demonstrated during the evaluation process. 

— we don't hold back when we find truly outstanding talent.

ELT - 30.50 LPA (25 LPA Fixed + 2.5 LPA + 3 LPA Stock-Linked Long-Term Incentive Plan) + Esops 7 L (Excluding 2.5L of Medical cover)

EIT - 22.80 LPA (18 LPA Fixed + 1.8 LPA + 3 LPA Stock-Linked Long-Term Incentive Plan)+ Esops 5 L  (Excluding 2.5L of Medical cover)

job_description:
Trainee Process Engineer 

Key Responsibility Areas (KRA)

Position: Trainee Process Engineer – Detail Engineering

Reporting To: General Manager – Engineering Design

Company: SFC Environmental Technologies Ltd


ABOUT SFC ENVIRONMENTAL TECHNOLOGIES LTD.

Innovating for a Sustainable Tomorrow: SFC Environmental Technologies is at the forefront of tackling critical environmental challenges. We're not just building solutions; we're building a sustainable future. Our advanced technologies, including C-Tech wastewater treatment and OREX solid waste segregation, are setting new industry standards. Be part of a team that's making a real difference.

VISION

“Be the trusted leader in environmental technologies, continuously innovating to create value, inspiring sustainable change for a better tomorrow.”

MISSION

“Harnessing technology and human insights to develop and deliver simple, flexible, and cost-effective environmental solutions.”


Role Overview

We are seeking a detail-oriented Trainee Process Engineer – Detail Engineering with 0–2 years of experience in wastewater treatment to join our Detail Engineering team. The role offers an excellent opportunity to learn and contribute to the preparation and review of technical engineering documents, selection of appropriate treatment schemes, and basic design calculations. The candidate will also support coordination with vendors and project stakeholders. A basic understanding or academic exposure to STP/ETP/CETP technologies such as ASP, MBBR, SBR and MBR will be beneficial. Training and guidance will be provided to develop expertise, particularly in SBR-based treatment systems. The role involves preparing and reviewing technical engineering documents, selecting treatment schemes, conducting design calculations, and coordinating with vendors and stakeholders. The key responsibilities of this role include,



1. Tender & Basic Engineering Package Analysis:

·       Analyze tender specifications and prepare comprehensive Basic Engineering Packages for wastewater treatment projects using SBR technology.

 

 

2. Process Design & Scheme Selection:

  • Conduct process and hydraulic design calculations, select treatment schemes, and prepare engineering inputs like PFDs, P&IDs, and hydraulic profiles


3. Drawings & Documentation Coordination:

  • Collaborate with the drafting team to develop and review technical drawings, equipment layouts, and specification documents


4. Vendor Interaction:

•             Coordinate with vendors to obtain quotations and technical details of equipment for project evaluation

5. Site Visits & Data Collection:

•             Conduct field visits to assess existing infrastructure and gather relevant data for feasibility and design validation

6. Stakeholder Coordination:

•             Liaise with internal teams, clients, contractors, and regulatory authorities to ensure alignment on technical specifications and compliance.

7. Compliance & Standards:

•             Ensure that all engineering outputs adhere to relevant industry codes, environmental regulations, and project-specific quality standards.

8. Construction & Commissioning Support:

•             Provide technical assistance during the construction, commissioning, and start-up phases of the project lifecycle.



Key Performance Indicators (KPIs)

1. Design Accuracy

·       Percentage of drawings and calculations approved without revision.

·       Number of design-related reworks.

2. Timely Delivery

·       Percentage of engineering deliverables submitted on or before deadline.

·       On-time completion of Basic Engineering Package

3. Process Design Validation

·       Accuracy of process/hydraulic calculations validated during commissioning.

·       Deviation rate between design and actual performance

4. Site & Stakeholder Support

·       Number of site issues resolved through engineering inputs.

5. Value Engineering

·       Cost savings achieved through design optimization

·       Number of design improvements or innovations implemented.

Academic Qualifications

·       M Tech Environment Engineering and BTech in related Fields (with relevant experience preferred)

Skills & Competencies Required

·       0-2 years of relevant experience in wastewater treatment detailed engineering

·       Familiarity with engineering codes and environmental regulations

·       Strong analytical and process calculation skills

·       Proficiency in interpreting and generating technical drawings and documentation

·       Effective communication, stakeholder coordination, and team collaboration



Reporting Structure & Collaboration

•             Reports To: General Manager – Engineering Design

•             Collaborates With: 

o   Internal departments (Process, Design, Procurement, Projects, Commissioning)

o   Clients, contractors, and equipment vendors

o   Drafting and Documentation Team

o   Quality & Compliance Team

The Trainee Process Engineer - Detail Engineering at SFC Environmental Technologies Ltd. plays a key role in translating conceptual designs into technically sound, execution-ready engineering packages. By preparing process calculations, technical drawings, and documentation, the individual ensures the engineering integrity of wastewater treatment systems. This role supports cross-functional teams, interfaces with vendors and site engineers, and ensures regulatory compliance, contributing to the timely and effective delivery of SFC's sustainable water solutions.

job_description:
About the Opportunity

Join a leading technology firm at the forefront of digital innovation in the tech sector. job_description:
Trainee Process Engineer 

Key Responsibility Areas (KRA)

Position: Trainee Process Engineer – Detail Engineering

Reporting To: General Manager – Engineering Design

Company: SFC Environmental Technologies Ltd


ABOUT SFC ENVIRONMENTAL TECHNOLOGIES LTD.

Innovating for a Sustainable Tomorrow: SFC Environmental Technologies is at the forefront of tackling critical environmental challenges. We're not just building solutions; we're building a sustainable future. Our advanced technologies, including C-Tech wastewater treatment and OREX solid waste segregation, are setting new industry standards. Be part of a team that's making a real difference.

VISION

“Be the trusted leader in environmental technologies, continuously innovating to create value, inspiring sustainable change for a better tomorrow.”

MISSION

“Harnessing technology and human insights to develop and deliver simple, flexible, and cost-effective environmental solutions.”


Role Overview

We are seeking a detail-oriented Trainee Process Engineer – Detail Engineering with 0–2 years of experience in wastewater treatment to join our Detail Engineering team. The role offers an excellent opportunity to learn and contribute to the preparation and review of technical engineering documents, selection of appropriate treatment schemes, and basic design calculations. The candidate will also support coordination with vendors and project stakeholders. A basic understanding or academic exposure to STP/ETP/CETP technologies such as ASP, MBBR, SBR and MBR will be beneficial. Training and guidance will be provided to develop expertise, particularly in SBR-based treatment systems. The role involves preparing and reviewing technical engineering documents, selecting treatment schemes, conducting design calculations, and coordinating with vendors and stakeholders. The key responsibilities of this role include,



1. Tender & Basic Engineering Package Analysis:

·       Analyze tender specifications and prepare comprehensive Basic Engineering Packages for wastewater treatment projects using SBR technology.

 

 

2. Process Design & Scheme Selection:

  • Conduct process and hydraulic design calculations, select treatment schemes, and prepare engineering inputs like PFDs, P&IDs, and hydraulic profiles


3. Drawings & Documentation Coordination:

  • Collaborate with the drafting team to develop and review technical drawings, equipment layouts, and specification documents


4. Vendor Interaction:

•             Coordinate with vendors to obtain quotations and technical details of equipment for project evaluation

5. Site Visits & Data Collection:

•             Conduct field visits to assess existing infrastructure and gather relevant data for feasibility and design validation

6. Stakeholder Coordination:

•             Liaise with internal teams, clients, contractors, and regulatory authorities to ensure alignment on technical specifications and compliance.

7. Compliance & Standards:

•             Ensure that all engineering outputs adhere to relevant industry codes, environmental regulations, and project-specific quality standards.

8. Construction & Commissioning Support:

•             Provide technical assistance during the construction, commissioning, and start-up phases of the project lifecycle.



Key Performance Indicators (KPIs)

1. Design Accuracy

·       Percentage of drawings and calculations approved without revision.

·       Number of design-related reworks.

2. Timely Delivery

·       Percentage of engineering deliverables submitted on or before deadline.

·       On-time completion of Basic Engineering Package

3. Process Design Validation

·       Accuracy of process/hydraulic calculations validated during commissioning.

·       Deviation rate between design and actual performance

4. Site & Stakeholder Support

·       Number of site issues resolved through engineering inputs.

5. Value Engineering

·       Cost savings achieved through design optimization

·       Number of design improvements or innovations implemented.

Academic Qualifications

·       M Tech Environment Engineering and BTech in related Fields (with relevant experience preferred)

Skills & Competencies Required

·       0-2 years of relevant experience in wastewater treatment detailed engineering

·       Familiarity with engineering codes and environmental regulations

·       Strong analytical and process calculation skills

·       Proficiency in interpreting and generating technical drawings and documentation

·       Effective communication, stakeholder coordination, and team collaboration



Reporting Structure & Collaboration

•             Reports To: General Manager – Engineering Design

•             Collaborates With: 

o   Internal departments (Process, Design, Procurement, Projects, Commissioning)

o   Clients, contractors, and equipment vendors

o   Drafting and Documentation Team

o   Quality & Compliance Team

The Trainee Process Engineer - Detail Engineering at SFC Environmental Technologies Ltd. plays a key role in translating conceptual designs into technically sound, execution-ready engineering packages. By preparing process calculations, technical drawings, and documentation, the individual ensures the engineering integrity of wastewater treatment systems. This role supports cross-functional teams, interfaces with vendors and site engineers, and ensures regulatory compliance, contributing to the timely and effective delivery of SFC's sustainable water solutions.
skill_set: Strong technical knowledge of Solid Waste and Waste Water technologies
perks: Diwali bonus (1 Month gros) to confirmed employees

Employment (Placement) Tracks:-

1. Engineering Impact Track (EIT)

This track is designed for students with strong fundamentals who show high potential but may need additional time, mentorship, and structured learning to ramp up.

What EIT offers:

  • High-quality, in-depth technical mentorship

  • Time to build expertise on our tech stack

  • Opportunity to work on key modules with senior engineers

  • A growth path that allows transition into leadership roles based on performance

EIT focuses on skill-building, strong execution, and becoming a high-impact contributor.

2. Engineering Leadership Track (ELT)

This is a fast-track program for students who already demonstrate exceptional technical depth, strong ownership mindset, and leadership readiness during our evaluation process.

Along with higher compensation, ELT comes with higher expectations and broader responsibilities.

What ELT offers (beyond salary):

  • Early ownership of end-to-end modules/features

  • Opportunities to lead smaller pods or projects within the first year itself

  • Higher visibility with the CTO and leadership team

  • Faster promotion bandwidth based purely on delivered outcomes

  • Additional ESOP bracket as part of the long-term leadership pipeline

ELT is meant for candidates who can take on larger responsibilities from Day 1 and influence product direction, not just execute tasks.

Your final track assignment will depend on interview performance, technical depth, problem-solving ability, and leadership potential demonstrated during the evaluation process. 

 

— we don't hold back when we find truly outstanding talent.

ELT - 30.50 LPA (25 LPA Fixed + 2.5 LPA + 3 LPA Stock-Linked Long-Term Incentive Plan) + Esops 7 L (Excluding 2.5L of Medical cover)

EIT - 22.80 LPA (18 LPA Fixed + 1.8 LPA + 3 LPA Stock-Linked Long-Term Incentive Plan)+ Esops 5 L  (Excluding 2.5L of Medical cover)

job_description:
The Team & Product

Our team focuses on backend engineering and system performance. We build the core platforms—from endpoint agents to data processing pipelines—that allow our security analysts to detect and respond to threats at scale.

 


About The Role 

We are looking for a Software Engineer with strong Computer Science foundations to join our team.

This is a backend engineering role focused on building high-performance software. You will apply your knowledge of data structures, algorithms, and operating systems to solve real-world challenges in data processing and distributed systems. You will work closely with senior engineers who will mentor you in writing robust, production-grade code.

 


What You’ll Do

• Develop Core Software: Write efficient, maintainable code (Go, C++, Rust, or Java) for our backend services and security tools.

• Apply CS Fundamentals: Use your knowledge of data structures and algorithms to optimize data processing logic and solve performance bottlenecks.

• System Debugging: Investigate and fix issues across the stack, from memory leaks in agents to latency issues in our data pipelines.

• Collaborate & Learn: Participate in technical design discussions and code reviews to learn how to architect scalable distributed systems.

• Build Automated Tests: Write unit and integration tests to ensure the reliability and stability of the software you ship.

• What You’ll Need

• Computer Science Foundation: A strong grasp of core CS concepts, including Data Structures (Trees, Hash Maps, Queues), Algorithms (Sorting, Search, Complexity Analysis), and Object-Oriented Design.

• Coding Proficiency: Fluency in at least one modern programming language (e.g., C++, Java, Rust, or Golang). You should be comfortable writing code that manages memory and resources efficiently.

• Operating Systems Knowledge: Understanding of OS internals such as processes, threads, concurrency, and file systems.

• Networking Basics: Fundamental understanding of how networks operate (TCP/IP, HTTP, DNS).

• Problem Solving: A demonstrated ability to break down technical problems and implement clean, logical solutions.

Bonus Points

• Experience with Competitive Programming or algorithmic challenges.

• Comfortable working in a Linux environment.

• Personal projects that demonstrate an interest in systems programming or security.

• Exposure to databases (SQL) or basic distributed system concepts.

job_description:
Description

We are seeking a technically strong and curious Cyber Security Researcher to join our Security Operations Center (SOC) team. This role involves researching evolving cybersecurity techniques, tools, and standards, and translating those insights into technical solutions, PoCs, and operational enhancements. You will collaborate with Product Managers, SOC Analysts, and Development teams to support the design and improvement of detection logic, security workflows, and platform capabilities. If you’re passionate about diving into academic research, security frameworks, and experimenting with PoCs—this role is for you.

Responsibilities

  • Conduct structured research on cyber defense strategies, adversary tradecraft (e.g., MITRE ATT&CK TTPs), and modern detection methodologies including IDS/IPS tuning, packet analysis, and behavior-based analytics.
  • Analyze and synthesize content from technical research papers, threat intelligence feeds, vulnerability databases (e.g., CVE, CWE, CAPEC), and industry standards (e.g., NIST, ISO, CISA advisories).
  • Develop and validate Proof-of-Concepts (PoCs) for detection logic, telemetry enrichment, security automation workflows, or EDR/SIEM rule tuning using tools like YARA, Sigma, Zeek, Wazuh and Suricata.
  • Translate complex cybersecurity research into actionable feature requirements and detection enhancements in collaboration with Product Management.
  • Collaborate with Engineering and SOC teams to design, test, and deploy detection pipelines, log ingestion rules, and enrichment mechanisms in platforms such as Splunk, ELK, or Microsoft Sentinel.
  • Prepare clear and concise technical documentation, detection logic explainers, internal advisories, and research briefs for engineering and SOC consumption.
  • Maintain and enhance internal detection rulesets, enrichment scripts, and threat response content in line with evolving threat landscapes and platform capabilities.
  • Continuously align detection content and SOC workflows with industry frameworks such as MITRE ATT&CK, D3FEND, NIST 800-53/800-61, and ISO/IEC 27001.
  • Present research findings and detection strategies to cross-functional teams, demonstrating strong written and verbal communication skills.

Eligibility

  • Bachelor’s/Master’s/PhD degree in Cybersecurity, Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related technical field.
  • 3+ years in a cybersecurity-focused role, including internships, research projects, or academic contributions. • Strong knowledge of core cybersecurity domains:

o Network security (TCP/IP, IDS/IPS, packet analysis).

o Operating system internals (Windows/Linux security primitives).

o Security controls (IAM, encryption, logging, EDR/SIEM integrations).

o Familiarity with detection and investigation tooling such as:

o YARA, Sigma, Suricata, OSQuery, Zeek, Wazuh.

o SIEM platforms (e.g., Splunk, ELK, Microsoft Sentinel).

o EDR tools (e.g., CrowdStrike, Defender for Endpoint).

o Understanding of data formats (JSON, YAML), REST APIs, and basic log analysis.

  • Strong documentation and presentation skills — ability to explain complex technical topics in a structured manner.
  • Familiarity with CVE databases, CWE, CAPEC, and vulnerability scoring systems (CVSS) is a plus.
perks: Insurance, PF

job_description:
Description

C3iHub, IIT Kanpur is seeking a highly motivated and skilled Malware Analysis Researcher to join our cybersecurity research team. The ideal candidate will possess a strong foundation in static and dynamic malware analysis, with hands-on experience in reverse engineering, automation, and machine learning-based malware detection. You will work on analyzing real-world malware samples, building automation pipelines, curating datasets, and developing innovative solutions to detect and mitigate emerging threats. This role also involves publishing research articles and collaborating on advanced detection frameworks.

Responsibilities

Key Responsibilities:

• Perform static and dynamic analysis of malware samples across formats (PE, PDF, ELF, APK).

• Automate analysis tasks using Python, Bash, or other scripting tools.

• Set up and maintain sandbox environments (e.g., Cuckoo Sandbox) for behavior monitoring.

• Analyze packed, encrypted, or obfuscated malware using reverse engineering techniques.

• Utilize and contribute to open-source tools (e.g., YARA, Volatility, Ghidra, Radare2).

• Curate and label malware datasets for use in machine learning pipelines.

• Conduct source code analysis using SAST and DAST tools.

• Author technical documentation and publish research articles in the field.

• Collaborate with internal teams on threat research, detection model tuning, and PoC development.

• Travel (within India) occasionally for project-related meetings, demonstrations, or coordination.

Eligibility

Required Qualifications:

• Master’s degree in Computer Science, Information Security, or related field.

• 1–2 years of hands-on experience in malware analysis or reverse engineering.

• Proficiency in scripting (e.g., Python, Bash) and familiarity with threat analysis tools.

• Strong understanding of malware behavior, file formats, and analysis techniques.

Preferred Qualifications:

• Specialization in Cybersecurity or Information Security.

• Experience with tools such as IDA Pro, Ghidra, Wireshark, or Sysmon.

• Exposure to ML/AI-based malware classification projects.

• Research publications in reputable cybersecurity journals or conferences.

Travel

As and when required, across the country for project execution and monitoring as well as for coordination with geographically distributed teams.

Communication

  • Submit a cover letter summarising your experience in relevant technologies and software along with a resume and the Latest passport-size photograph.
skill_set: IDA Pro, Ghidra, Wireshark, or Sysmon
perks: Insurance, PF

profile: Sr Analyst – Risk and Portfolio management
job_description:
The finance industry has ignored billions of deserving individuals. We are a mission driven team of finance, analytics and technology professionals, focused on driving financial inclusion to serve the underserved across their credit, savings and financial needs.

 

This role will be accountable for managing analytical and execution workstreams including Portfolio Performance Monitoring, Campaign Management, Credit Strategy Development and Debt Collection Operations that drive the lending portfolio P&L outcomes.

 

This role offers an opportunity to learn the business and technical aspects of digital lending and offers a fast-track progression into strategy & policy ownership roles.

 

What we are looking for: 

 

-       Passion for analytics:

o  Should demonstrate understanding of machine learning/big data analytics through project thesis as part of the academics or participation in data science competitions. Should have hands on experience and track record of delivering projects in individual capacity.

-       Problem Solving and Communication:

o  Should have the ability to structure business problems, articulate key issues/problem statements, identify opportunities and address challenges through innovative solutions. This will be evaluated through case studies that will be part of the assessment.

-       Process oriented:

o  Should help in designing and building optimal processes that can be used to automate manual operations. There needs to be an obsession with collecting, analyzing data and automate tasks to drive business iterations and improvements.

-       Willingness to go above and beyond:

o  For start-ups the responsibilities and needs of the business change quickly. We're looking for someone who is not afraid to take on calculated risks and can deal with ambiguity.

 

Job Responsibilities:

 

-       Digital Lending Portfolio Strategy & Credit Policy

o  Support portfolio managers in credit analysis to drive Go-To-Market strategy, Optimize customer underwriting and limit management through credit life cycle.

o  Collaborate with product and customer success teams to develop and implement a “Test & Learn” approach for various messages, offers etc

-       Portfolio Monitoring, Communication & Automation

o  Build and Track various Portfolio Monitoring MIS against plan

o  Execute campaigns to drive uptake, usage and repayment, track performance KPIs

o  Build and maintain collection MIS and support performance tracking with collection agencies

o  Optimize workstreams via automation through various tools (SQL, Pyspark, Python)

job_description:
Role Overview

We are looking for an AI/ML Engineer who can mentor high-potential scholars in creating impactful technology projects. This role requires a blend of strong engineering expertise, the ability to distill complex topics into digestible concepts, and a deep passion for student-driven innovation. You’ll help scholars explore the frontiers of AI—from machine learning models to generative AI systems—while coaching them in best practices and applied engineering.

Key Responsibilities

  • Guide scholars through the full AI/ML development cycle—from problem definition, data exploration, and model selection to evaluation and deployment.

  • Teach and assist in building:

  • Supervised and unsupervised machine learning models.

  • Deep learning networks (CNNs, RNNs, Transformers).

  • NLP tasks such as classification, summarization, and Q&A systems.

  • Provide mentorship in Prompt Engineering:

  • Craft optimized prompts for generative models like GPT-4 and Claude.

  • Teach the principles of few-shot, zero-shot, and chain-of-thought prompting.

  • Experiment with fine-tuning and embeddings in LLM applications.

  • Support scholars with real-world datasets (e.g., Kaggle, open data repositories) and help integrate APIs, automation tools, or ML Ops workflows.

  • Conduct internal training and code reviews, ensuring technical rigor in projects.

  • Stay updated with the latest research, frameworks, and tools in the AI ecosystem.

Technical Requirements

Core Skills

  • Proficiency in Python and ML libraries: scikit-learn, XGBoost, Pandas, NumPy.

  • Experience with deep learning frameworks: TensorFlow, PyTorch, Keras.

  • Strong command of machine learning theory, including:

  • Bias-variance tradeoff, regularization, and model tuning.

  • Cross-validation, hyperparameter optimization, and ensemble techniques.

  • Solid understanding of data processing pipelines, data wrangling, and visualization (Matplotlib, Seaborn, Plotly).

Advanced AI & NLP

  • Experience with transformer architectures (e.g., BERT, GPT, T5, LLaMA).

  • Hands-on with LLM APIs: OpenAI (ChatGPT), Anthropic, Cohere, Hugging Face.

  • Understanding of embedding-based retrieval, vector databases (e.g., Pinecone, FAISS), and Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG).

  • Familiarity with AutoML tools, MLflow, Weights & Biases, and cloud AI platforms (AWS SageMaker, Google Vertex AI).

Prompt Engineering & GenAI

  • Proficiency in crafting effective prompts using:

  • Instruction tuning

  • Role-playing and system prompts

  • Prompt chaining tools like LangChain or LlamaIndex

  • Understanding of AI safety, bias mitigation, and interpretability.

Required Qualifications

  • B.Tech/B.E. or higher in Computer Science, Data Science, or a related field.

  • 0-2 years of relevant experience in ML/AI roles.

  • Portfolio of projects or publications in AI/ML (GitHub, blogs, competitions, etc.)

  • Passion for education, mentoring, and working with high school scholars.

Preferred Qualifications

  • Prior experience in student mentorship, teaching, or edtech.

  • Exposure to Arduino, Raspberry Pi, or IoT for integrated AI/ML projects.

  • Strong storytelling and documentation abilities to help scholars write compelling project reports and research summaries.

job_description:
Role overview

Designation: Associate

Location: Bangalore, Kolkata, Hyderabad and Mumbai

As an Associate in PwC’s Consulting practice, you’ll be part of a team of problem solvers

leveraging cloud data platforms, Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning, Data

Engineering and Data Analytics to help clients solve complex business challenges. You will

work at the intersection of technology, strategy, and execution designing data-driven

solutions that deliver measurable business impact.

This role demands strong analytical rigor, technical proficiency, multi-tasking capabilities,

and a consulting mindset that can translate data insights into actionable outcomes.

Core responsibilities as an Associate would entail (but not limited to):

• AI, LLMs, NLP & Generative AI:

o Build GenAI and NLP (Natural Language Processing) solutions using LLMs

(Large Language Models -OpenAI / Azure / Open Source), including prompt

design and model tuning.

o Develop RAG pipelines with vector databases and embeddings for accurate,

context-aware retrieval.

o Apply core deep learning techniques (transformers, embeddings, sequence

models) for real-world AI use cases.

o Integrate AI models into applications and data platforms to enable intelligent

automation and insights.

o Ensure responsible AI practices through quality checks, monitoring, and

safety-focused development.

• Cloud data engineering:o Build and maintain data pipelines and workflows on Databricks using Python

and SQL, working with Delta Lake and modern file formats (Parquet and

JSON).

• Application and API development:

o Contribute to building data-driven applications and APIs using Python

frameworks such as RestAPI, FastAPI, integrating with Databricks jobs and

cloud services.

• Data governance, quality and security:

o Ensure compliance with data governance, privacy and quality standards,

including implementing validation checks, monitoring data quality, and

following secure coding practices while adhering to ethical AI practices.

• Automation and ways of working:

o Work in agile teams, contribute to sprint planning, and ensure timely delivery

of tasks aligned to overall project goals.

o Contribute to PwC’s digital innovation agenda by experimenting with

emerging technologies such as GenAI, LLMs, automation, and predictive

modeling.

• Consulting and collaboration:

o Work closely with clients and cross-functional teams to understand strategic

goals, assess challenges, and co-create data and AI solutions.

o Communicate insights effectively through compelling dashboards,

visualizations, documentation and presentations, enabling stakeholders to

act on data-driven recommendations.

job_description:
About Just Dial

Justdial is India's leading local search engine, helping users find relevant providers of products and services, while also helping businesses market their offerings. It has a wide range of services including the B2B Platform JdMart, Bills and recharge, Book A Table, Deals & Offers, Flight Tickets etc.

Justdial's services are available on the web, mobile website, apps, voice (8888888888), and text (SMS). The company employs over 13K people and has reach to more than 50 million businesses (Click here for more details).

Why work with us

  • The opportunity to learn and work with some of the best Strategy, Tech, Content, and Business names in the industry
  • Provide you insights into all aspects of building a high-growth & and ever evolving successful digital company
  • A highly challenging and intellectually stimulating environment with diversified tasks and direct ownership
  • Defined growth path with significant and high-growth opportunities
  • Opportunity to scale a massive platform by unlocking value for 50mn+ SME’s

About GET program

Our second GET program- a fast-track program designed to move you up the organization and take on impactful roles within 1 year. Post onboarding, you will be introduced with senior leaders to better understand the organization mission, values and culture. During the first 6 months of the program, you will work within various CFT's on key strategic initiatives to facilitate organization-wide learning. Post that, you would be inducted in one of the business functions- Sales Strategy, Business Operations,

Category Management, Product Operations, Content Strategy or Program management, tasked with key initiatives which have direct impact on organization’s top/ bottom line. GET program makes you eligible for fast-track growth basis your performance besides encouraging horizontal movement between functions. All GET's are assigned a mentor for the initial 2 years to help them navigate their journey in Justdial.

What we are looking for

  • You come with an entrepreneurial mindset and want to change the way millions of merchants and users transact on the internet.
  • You are passionate about internet-based products and services that offer delightful consumer experiences,
  • You are detail-oriented and possess excellent problem-solving skills along with strong knowledge of advanced Excel, SQL and Python.
  • You are constantly updated about the latest advancements and developments in the fields of AI and ML, actively following new research, techniques, and applications in these areas.
  • You are a lifelong learner and want to hone leadership skills such as strategic vision, analytical thinking, execution capability, stakeholder management, presentation & communication skills.
  • You are an explorer who can work with minimum supervision and can keep the bigger picture in mind while effectively managing the details.

Values we cherish

  • Accountable- You take ownership of your work, can work with minimum supervision and honour deadlines
  • Adaptable- You can work in an unstructured environment. As a matter of fact, you embrace uncertainty and see it as an opportunity to learn and grow
  • Learner for life- You are a quick learner, are excited about solving new or previously unsolvable problems and believe in constantly upgrading your skills.
  • Team Player- You enjoy working with people and gel well with cross functional teams.

Roles & Responsibilities:

You will be a crucial part of program teams or CFT’s with clear mandate to define problem statements and execute solutions at scale.

Your major responsibilities will include:

  • Analyse large datasets to identify key issues in current process/ product related touch points with users/ merchants
  • Design processes and suggest product features to improve user experience as per the defined metric
  • Define and implement strategies to improve overall product/ listing quality in scalable manner
  • Perform customer research to identify pain points during customer life cycle to improve customer retention, understand unfulfilled user needs that we can solve
  • Work along with and manage multiple stakeholders to implement solutions within stated timelines
  • Prepare meaningful reports and dashboards to provide a 10000ft view of the problem and the solution to the leadership

job_description:
Job Role Summary 

  • The role of this position is to support the process improvement/development in metallurgical process refineries/industries.
  • Deliver scientific or technical solution through research and developmental program.     
  • Capable for technical ideation & scoping of new R&D projects. 
  • Publications and Presentations

Job Requirements 

  • Master’s degree from the recognized university in the following discipline: Chemical Engineering with good academic & professional records.
  • Project work preferably in process optimization through experimentation and simulations (such as ASPEN, etc.).  

Must have

  • Should have knowledge of chemical processes and equipment: mixing vessels, pressure reactors, separators and classifiers, etc.
  • Fundamentals of fluid, heat & mass-transfer operations.
  • Should be willing to work in a team and at plant site. Good presentation and communication skills.
  • Able to setup and conduct experimentations to arrive at scientific inferences.

Good to have

  • Experience in process industries/ research & development
  • Experience of process scale-up Stirred tanks, gas scrubbing systems etc.
  • Conversant with one or more modeling tools such as ASPEN plus 
  • Exposure to material characterization techniques such as XRF, XRD, etc. is preferrable

company_name: Aditya Birla Science & Technology Company Pvt. Ltd
job_description:
Roles & Responsibilities:

  • Execute R&D projects in “Process Modelling & Scale up” area of Cement Domain.
  • Visit the plant/customer to gather information about the process and process equipment.
  • Carry out simulations/data analytics and validations with plant data. Interpretation of simulations and experimental results & data for root cause analysis.
  • Develop expert solutions for the respective projects with effective collaborations across cross-functional teams, adherence to timelines and budget.
  • Implementation of technical solutions in the plant.
  • Publish/present in National/International Journals/Conferences.


Skills:

  • Knowledge of Process modelling using Computational Fluid Dynamics (CFD) or ASPEN.
  • Fundamental understanding of the principals of fluid dynamics/ reaction engineering/ combustion/ heat and mass transfer and multiphase turbulent fluid problems.
  • Good Communication and Presentation skills.


Good to Have:

  • Knowledge in Data visualization, statistical analysis & Data Analytics with AI ML modelling.
  • Writing own codes in MATLAB, R, Python
  • knowledge of scientific, high-performance and cloud computing tools and technologies

Summary

Raspa is a biopharmaceutical company that is committed to reducing the cost of treatment for cancer and other severe diseases. Our diverse and inclusive team is amalgamating technological innovation and automation strategies to make healthcare more accessible, affordable, and sustainable.

We are looking for a talented individual with a zeal to innovate to join our dynamic organization. Qualified individuals will play a leading role in novel process development for proteins and biosimilars. This position is expected to be mainly hands-on in the laboratory. The person will be reporting to the CEO.

Roles and responsibilities:

  • Design and execute the development of a novel process for the biosynthetic molecules of interest
  • Use Design of Experiment (DoE) to screen process conditions and optimize the process
  • Plan, coordinate, and execute activities for process monitoring and process data analysis
  • Perform independent data recording, analysis, and troubleshooting, and support the generation of critical process documents
  • Lead and implement process scale-up activities
  • Conduct technical investigations and risk assessments related with processes to resolve complex technical or operational problems
  • Implement continuous process improvement aimed at process robustness and productivity
  • Determine the root causes of process variation and identify process trends to increase efficiency

Our ideal candidate will have:

  • PhD or Master’s degree in Bioprocess Engineering, Chemical Engineering, or related discipline
  • A previous track record of handling equipment such as Bioreactors, HPLC, and associated upstream and downstream equipment
  • Ability to solve complex engineering problems involving Heat transfer, Mass transfer & fluid mechanics

job_description:
System Software Engineer Job Description

Team: System Software Team – GPU / Tegra

Role: Full - time

As a Software Engineer, the candidate will be responsible for supporting in design and development of software solutions in the areas of Chip Resource Manager, Graphics, Video, 2D and 3D graphics under OpenGL and DirectX, ISP, driver stacks for Windows and Linux OS. Also, the responsibility will include improvement of existing software, micro code and suggesting modifications in hardware acceleration solutions. The candidate will work side by side with Nvidia engineers around the world, as an equal member of a multi-site project team. The candidate must be highly motivated, enthusiastic, pro-active to achieve high-quality software deliveries. The candidate will be working on System software’s various driver modules/features/tools/performance.

We are looking for candidates who are passionate about working at the intersection of leading-edge graphics, multimedia and operating system software.

Looking for candidates who will be working in the following areas:



Principles of hardware operation: CPU and memory architecture, buses and interconnects



Operating System fundamentals: multi-processing and scheduling, memory management, privilege modes, file systems and device drivers



Algorithms and data structures



Principles of parallel computing



C and/or C++ programming languages



Python / PERL knowledge is preferred.

What we look for:



Strong academic background



BTech/MTech in CS, ECE, EEE, EE



Good understanding of programming languages and processor architecture



Good understanding of Operating System Fundamentals. Knowledge of Linux kernel is a plus.



Strong C/C++ programming skills



Knowledge of scripting (Perl or python) is a plus.



Candidates should have a solid background in

a)

Operating System, Algorithm development

b)

Knowledge on Object-oriented programing is highly a Plus in C / C++ Or Java

c)

Aptitude in innovative and optimal designs



Exposure to Digital Systems, Computer Architecture, Computer Arithmetic, Software Engg., C & C++ programming languages, assembly language programming, system level integration & system level programming is preferred.



Good communications skills and ability and desire to work as a team player are a must.

NEW COLLEGE GRADUATE JOB DESCRIPTION We, at NVIDIA, want to find and bring the brightest young technologists of our generation to do their life’s best work at NVIDIA. We are hiring across multiple positions in our HW teams and a brief about the teams and their requirements is given below. GPU ARCHITECTURE TEAM GPU architecture team is engaged in the development of industry leading high performance and power efficient GPUs. Specific areas include architecture modeling, analysis and performance verification. The team works on GPUs across all application domains such as gaming for PC and mobile devices, professional graphics & visualization and high-performance computation. Skills you will use/develop: • C++ modeling, test development • RTL design, debug • ASIC design & verification tools, methodologies • Computer architecture, Graphics, GPU micro-architecture, parallel computing • Performance evaluation, analysis and debug • Perl/Python scripting Areas you will be working on: COMPUTER ARCHITECTURE; MEMORY SYSTEMS ARCHITECTURE, COMPILER ARCHITECTURE/ PERFORMANCE MODELING TEGRA SOC DESIGN & VERIFICATION Tegra ASIC team (Design Verification) As a Hardware Engineer at NVIDIA you will design and implement the industry's leading Graphics, Video and Mobile Communications Processors. Specific areas include 2D and 3D graphics, mpeg, video, audio, network protocols, high-speed IO interfaces and bus protocols, and memory subsystem design. You will be responsible for Architecture and micro-architecture design of the ASICs, RTL design and synthesis, Logic and Timing verification using leading edge CAD tools and Semiconductor process technologies Areas you will be working on: • ASIC, RTL, DESIGN AND VERIFICATION OF PROCESSORS • Low Power verification • Power Estimation and Modeling • PCIe Design verification • Functional / Formal verification CPU VERIFICATION TEAM As a design verification engineer in the Nvidia's CPU team, you will be working on the next generation of 64bit ARM architecture-based CPUs and SOCs. As part of this assignment, the intern will get a chance to learn about computer architecture at a very granular level, System Verilog, Unit/Cluster /SOC Verification, cutting edge verification methodologies and C/C++/ASM programming. The intern also will get an opportunity to get familiar with industry standard tools in verification and validation. During the course of the internship, the intern will contribute to building test benches, developing architectural simulators, modifying random instruction

generators and creating stimulus for verification and validation of different units of the CPU and SOC. Areas you will be working on • Computer Architecture • Digital Design and Programming in C/C++/Perl • ARM, CPU Design and Verification/ Validation ASIC-PD (Physical Design/Timing Closure / VLSI) As a member of our ASIC backend/timing team, you'll be working on product designs, focusing on such tasks as clocks, timing convergence, chip layout planning, design optimization and automation of workflows. Specifically, you'll be focusing on full chip layout planning (partitioning, planning clock distribution and other structures, methodology), full chip timing closure signoff (using tools such as Synopsys Primetime, Cadence Tempus etc.), design optimization, and gate-level design of high-speed logic. In this role you will also interface with architecture, rtl design, layout implementation, methodology and custom design teams to drive design implementation, timing analysis/closure all the way from micro-architecture to tape-out. What you'll be doing: • Develop and enhance timing analysis/signoff workflow from the frontend (pre-layout) to backend (post-layout) at both chip and block level. • Chip level Integration, physically partitioning and floor planning. • Develop custom timing scripts using tcl/primetime for clock skew analysis, special circuits such as clock dividers, core logic <-> IO macros interfaces such as PCI-E, Framebuffer/Memory, HDMI, etc. • Design optimization and timing convergence-related tasks. • Development of PD workflows.

job_description:
Exciting Career Opportunity

for Graduate & Postgraduate Trainees!

About Loxim

Loxim is a truly Made in India success story. Since our inception in 1977, we have grown into a leading global player in Chemical Dyes and Engineering Plastics, with a strong presence in Ahmedabad & Vadodara (India), Malaysia, Singapore, Indonesia, Germany, and the USA. Our pursuit of innovation and belief in infinite possibilities have now led us to expand into Pharmaceutical APIs and Intermediates manufacturing.

Now, we are looking for young, ambitious minds to join us and shape the future!

Website : www.loxim.com

Graduate & Postgraduate Training Program

This 12 months /6 months structured paid training program is designed to give you an opportunity to gain on-the job experience, network, gain in-depth understanding of our business operations and engage in professional development.

 

Graduate: 6-12 months of Training Period

Post Graduate Trainee: 6 months of Training Period

 

What to Expect?

ü Dedicated mentorship for professional growth.

ü Comprehensive exposure to key departments – Production, Quality, Maintenance, Sales & Business Development, Supply Chain, IT & ERP, and HR.

ü Work on impactful projects and collaborate with diverse teams

ü Understanding business dynamics and real-world problem-solving.

ü One-on-One Quarterly Feedback sessions

 

Evaluation & Career Growth

At the end of the training program:

ü Trainees submit a learning report detailing their experiences.

ü Mentors provide a performance evaluation report outlining strengths & areas for improvement.

ü Based on the evaluation, trainees will be offered positions in any of the following departments: QC, Production, Maintenance, Sales & Business Development, Supply Chain, QMS or Operations.

ü The trainees' preferences will be considered; however, the final decision regarding department allocation rests with the Human Resource Department and will be binding on all parties.

 

Career Path

 

 

Career Path – Leadership Role

 

Who Can Apply?

 Educational Qualifications:

 Bachelor’s or Master’s in:

• Chemistry / Chemical/ Pharmaceutical

If you’re ready to kick-start your career in a dynamic and innovation-driven environment, Loxim is the place for you!

 Job location: Ahmedabad (Corporate Office / Factory (Sanand))

 Remuneration: Graduate Trainees - Upto 4 lakhs | Post Graduate Trainees – Upto 10 Lakhs* (Remuneration will depend on the overall evaluation score of the candidate)

 *For Postgraduate remuneration is inclusive of 2 lakhs of retention amount which is paid out after successful completion of two years.

 Join us and be part of a future filled with infinite possibilities!

- Build and maintain backend features, APIs, and integrations that power Zenskar’s billing automation and revenue recognition capabilities

- Collaborate with senior engineers to design and develop reliable, scalable systems

- Learn to implement integrations with CRMs, data warehouses, ERPs, and payment processors

- Contribute to optimizing performance, scalability, and system reliability - Write clean, maintainable code and participate in code reviews

- Debug and troubleshoot issues across the backend stack

- Work with product and operations teams to understand requirements and translate them into technical solutions 

The Impact You’ll Make

- Learn to build systems that handle complex pricing models and real-time financial data

- Contribute to critical financial infrastructure used by fast-growing B2B companies - Gain hands-on experience with large-scale backend systems and distributed architecture

- Learn best practices in system design, API development, and database optimization

- Work closely with experienced engineers and founders, accelerating your technical growth

- Be part of shaping the foundation of a product used by companies managing millions in transactions

About Zenskar

Zenskar is building the next-generation billing and revenue platform for SaaS

and usage-based businesses. We’re backed by top investors and led by

founders who’ve built and scaled products at high-growth startups before.

You’ll be part of a small, talented team where your contributions directly

shape the product and the company’s trajectory. This is a rare opportunity to

learn from experienced engineers, work on high-impact systems, and grow

rapidly as a backend engineer.

Role Purpose: To conduct research under limited supervision either as a member of a team or where appropriate, independently.

 

Area of Responsibility

1.     Creation of R&I related assets: Development of research prototypes, tools or products as applicable, as well as applying for patents and communicating research publications, either individually or as part of a larger team.

 

2.     Research Execution: Participating in applied research work and communicating the same via papers targeted at top-tier venues, travelling and presenting the same at such conferences. 2. Contributes to the designs and implementation proof of concepts (PoCs) & prototypes based on research.  

 

3.     Continuous Learning: Participates in conferences and seminars (national/international) in the field of one's own expertise & meetings associated with research.

 

4.     Personal Development: Learning what it means to do cutting-edge applied research that is relevant and applicable in practice, as well as putting the same into practice via PoCs and co-innovation exercises with customers where applicable.

You’ll be responsible for building applications using some of the latest and greatest tech stacks — think Java, Flutter, .Net, Node.js, Salesforce, and more. Expect to work on exciting initiatives, collaborate with internal IT and Digital teams, and partner with external vendors to bring innovative solutions to life. 4. PRINCIPAL ACCOUNTABILITIES: ▪ Work side by side with seasoned developers to craft smart, scalable, and innovative software solutions. ▪ Dive into the complete software journey — from brainstorming and coding to testing, deploying, and keeping things running flawlessly. ▪ Write clean, efficient, and future-proof code that stands out for its quality and clarity. ▪ Hunt down bugs like a pro and make sure everything performs at its best. ▪ Stay curious, explore the latest tech trends, and bring bold, creative ideas to every project. ▪ Collaborate with awesome cross-functional teams to turn ideas into reality and deliver projects that make an impact.

job_description:
Role Over View:

Join Tanla’s cutting-edge Data Science Team, where innovation meets scale. You’ll work with massive datasets across messaging, telecom, and enterprise communication, building AI-powered models that impact millions of users in real time.

If you’re passionate about Machine Learning, AI, NLP, and Big Data, this is your opportunity to build and deploy production-scale intelligence systems from Day 1.

As a Data Science Engineer at Tanla, you will:

·      Explore and analyze data: Collect, clean, and visualize large-scale datasets to uncover trends, patterns, and actionable insights.

·      Engineer features: Design meaningful data transformations and feature sets that enhance model accuracy and robustness.

·      Build predictive models: Develop and experiment with ML models for prediction, optimization, and self-learning applications.

·      Work on NLP & LLM projects: Build and fine-tune text intelligence models for intent detection, message routing, summarization, and generative AI use cases.

·      Evaluate and fine-tune models: Assess model performance using key metrics, and fine-tune them to customize AI solutions for specific business use cases and real-world scenarios.

·      Deploy and monitor models: Take models to real-world production using scalable APIs, automation workflows, and real-time data pipelines.

·      Collaborate cross-functionally: Work closely with product, engineering, and business teams to translate data-driven insights into impactful decisions and features.

 

Who Can Apply

·      Strong fundamentals in Statistics, Probability, Linear Algebra, and Machine Learning.

·      Proficiency in Python and exposure to data handling (NumPy, Pandas, SQL).

·      Familiarity with ML algorithms, model evaluation, and exploratory data analysis.

·      Passion for solving real-world problems using AI and innovation.

Preferred (Good to Have)

·      Projects in AI / ML / NLP / GenAI / LLMs (academic or personal).

·      Understanding of the telecom or enterprise communication domain (optional) is a plus.

Why join us?

·      Impactful Work: Solve meaningful real-life business problems by building cutting-edge products.

·      Tremendous Growth Opportunities: Work in a fast-growing CPaaS and product-driven culture with scope for continuous professional development.

·      Innovative Environment: Be part of a world-class team that loves solving tough problems and values innovation.

Tanla is an equal opportunity employer. We champion diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.

🌐 www.tanla.com

job_description:
Our Structural Engineering practice collaborates with architects, building owners and builders to 

design elegant solutions for projects of all types, sizes and levels of complexity. From designing the 

world’s tallest buildings and longest spans to engineering inventive “jewel-box” structures and 

designing major expansion projects, we continually seek the best balance among the demands of 

form, function, sustainability, constructability, schedule and budget.  

 

The Role 

We have an opportunity for an Engineer to join our Structural Practice. Candidates for the Structural 

Engineer position should have experience in small size projects such as cultural buildings, office 

buildings, health care and research facility design, and tenant renovation work preferably in a 

consulting engineering firm environment. 

 

Responsibilities 

· Structural analysis, design and detailing for all types of buildings and materials using a variety of 

building codes. 

· Coordination of design work with in-house staff as well as other design professionals including 

Architects and other Engineering disciplines. 

· Preparation of construction documents within a BIM environment. 

 

Qualifications  

· Bachelor’s degree in Civil or Structural Engineering. 

· Working knowledge of current industry software, including SAP2000, ETABS, Ram, Risa3-D, PCA 

Software, Revit, and AutoCAD is preferred. 

· Ability and willingness to travel within the India and internationally.

·       Turn insights into real features used by millions.

·       Build and launch AI-driven learning experiences.

At Seekho, every role is a launchpad.

From day one, you’ll work on real strategy projects that shape the future of how India learns — alongside exceptional mentors from IITs, IIMs, ISB, and top consulting firms. You’ll learn how to think like a founder, solve like a strategist, and execute like a builder.

Product Roles – Product Management / Product Strategy

 

Here, your product decisions go live to thousands in weeks — not months. Design experiences that transform how Bharat learns. You’ll :

 

·       Turn user insights into powerful product features, enhance journeys, and own metrics that matter

·       Work alongside top minds in tech, design, and growth.

 

Skills You’ll Sharpen: Product thinking | User empathy | Analytical ability | Wireframing (Figma)

Start: Business Associate → Next: Strategy Lead → Future: Business Head

·       Work on real strategy projects with CXOs.

·       Drive growth experiments and new market launches.

·       Learn to think like a founder and execute like a consultant.


At Seekho, every role is a launchpad.

From day one, you’ll work on real strategy projects that shape the future of how India learns — alongside exceptional mentors from IITs, IIMs, ISB, and top consulting firms. You’ll learn how to think like a founder, solve like a strategist, and execute like a builder.

Business Roles – Strategy & Growth

 

Your ideas won’t sit in slides — they’ll shape how millions discover career-defining opportunities. You’ll : 

 

·       Work on high-impact projects driving growth, partnerships, and operational excellence.

·       Collaborate across teams to build scalable business models, optimize user funnels, and deliver measurable outcomes that move the company forward.

 

Skills You’ll Sharpen: Analytical thinking | Business acumen | Stakeholder management | Data-driven decision-making

 

Impact: Shape strategy today. Lead business tomorrow.

About RISA Labs

At RISA, we are building the future of mission-critical workflows by leveraging the latest in AI.

Our purpose is to solve humanity’s hardest hurdles, and we are starting with the incredibly

high-stakes challenges within oncology. We’re not just selling software; we are delivering a new

kind of resilient, autonomous infrastructure that powers foundational institutions and ultimately

helps accelerate human progress.

Founders

RISA was founded by Kshitij Jaggi and Kumar Shivang, IIT Kanpur alumni with a proven track

record from their previous healthcare startup, Urban Health. Their vision is to streamline

oncology care through cutting-edge technology.

Funding

RISA Labs is backed by $3.5 million in seed funding, led by Flipkart co-founder Binny Bansal,

with support from Oncology Ventures, General Catalyst, z21 Ventures, Odd Bird VC, and angel

investor Ashish Gupta.

The Opportunity

As a Technical Associate Product Manager (Technical APM) at RISA Labs, you’ll sit at the

intersection of AI systems, backend infrastructure, and healthcare workflows - shaping how our

technology is architected, delivered, and scaled in real-world oncology environments.

You’ll work closely with engineering, AI/ML, and infra teams to translate complex clinical and

operational requirements into robust technical specifications, APIs, and data workflows. You will

be hands-on with the product’s technical underpinnings - able to dive into architecture

discussions, understand tradeoffs, and help ensure we ship reliable, scalable systems that

clinicians can trust.

This role is ideal for someone who:

  1. Has a strong technical foundation and enjoys talking to engineers in their language
  2. Loves understanding system behavior in production just as much as UX flows
  3. Wants to see their technical decisions directly impact clinicians, hospitals, and ultimately,patients

What You’ll do

  1. Drive the end-to-end product lifecycle - from problem definition and discovery to launch and iteration
  2. Work closely with engineering and AI teams to turn product concepts into reliable, scalable technical solutions (services, APIs, data flows, and workflows)
  3. Collaborate with clinical experts, users, and customers to deeply understand their workflows, technical constraints, and data requirements
  4. Define and own product requirements, success metrics, and roadmaps that align with business goals and technical feasibility
  5. Translate complex AI and technical concepts into simple, clear product narratives, user experiences, and technical specs that engineers can execute on
  6. Contribute to high-level system design conversations with engineering (e.g., integration points, data contracts, edge cases, performance considerations)
  7. Work with engineers to ensure products are instrumented for observability – metrics, logs, and basic monitoring - and use these to understand system behavior in production
  8. Partner with founders and leadership to shape product vision, strategy, and go-to-market readiness for technically sophisticated capabilities
  9. Constantly measure impact, gather feedback, and iterate - ensuring that every release moves us closer to our mission

What You’ll Bring

Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Information Technology, or a related technical field

Internships or projects in software engineering, AI/ML, product, UX, or system design are a plus

Technically fluent and open to writing small amounts of code or scripts (for example, to explore APIs, inspect data, prototype ideas, or validate assumptions)

Ability to read and reason about technical artifacts - architecture diagrams, API specs, and basic logs/metrics – and have productive, detailed conversations with engineers

Strong analytical, problem-solving, and communication skills – you can connect the dots between user needs, technical feasibility, and business goals

A builder’s mindset - comfortable working in ambiguity, taking ownership, and making data-informed decisions

Curiosity for AI, healthcare, and how technology can make systems more human, efficient, and impactful

A bias for action - you like moving fast, learning fast, and seeing tangible outcomes from your work

job_description:
Graduate Development Engineer

We are looking for highly talented and ambitious individuals to join our Graduate Programme as Development Engineers. During a 12-month learning journey, you’ll learn from leaders, get involved in key projects, and build the skills to propel your career forward, as part of our Technology and Operations team. 

About our Technology & Operations Team 

Our Technology & Operations (T&O) team is the powerhouse for the Bank. We aim to go further, faster, to ensure we're agile and ready for tomorrow, today. Our diverse network enables us to innovate and build banking solutions that support communities to prosper. We're a place where talented people are encouraged to grow, learn, and thrive, to drive their own career journeys, to reach their full potential.  

 

When you work with us, you’re protecting the reputation and legacy of a 170 year organisation and building on it. We’re driven by progress and continuously evolving to ensure we’re agile and ready for tomorrow, today.   


About the Graduate Programme – how you’ll learn and grow

From day one, you’ll be immersed in real-world projects that matter. Our 12-month graduate programme is designed to accelerate your development and set you up for long-term success. You’ll benefit from:

  • Structured learning: Classroom training combined with hands-on experience
  • Global collaboration: Work with diverse teams and experienced leaders
  • Skill development: Build technical expertise and professional capabilities

Your programme starts with an 8-week Technical Bootcamp that will equip you with the necessary skills and understanding of technology architecture, programming languages, and how banking solutions can be rapidly designed and delivered. 

What you’ll be doing 

  • Design & development of robust banking software product development
  • Delivery quality software which meets the business requirements 
  • Work in a truly agile environment, as part of scrum teams that are striving to solve customer challenges
  • Participate in full software development lifecycle – requirements, design, implementation to deployment
  • Take full ownership and responsibility for product development and delivery 
  • Handling problems reported from the field and coming up with quick resolution, workaround, recovery, and fixes. 

Eligibility


We’re interested in people with diverse backgrounds. To be eligible for this role, you must be graduating from a Bachelor of Engineering course in 2026. You’ll also: 


  • Have some experience with programming algorithms, data structures, OOP concepts and frameworks, and database fundamentals. 
  • Have some knowledge and hands-on on experience in programming languages like C, C++, Java, Python, C#, or Dot Net.
  • Be familiar with design patterns, Microservices, UI frameworks – Angular, React, AI MS Office, MI & visualisation tools like Canva.
  • Have some knowledge of tools & frameworks like Selenium, JMETER, LoadRunner.
  • Be analytical, a critical thinker & have strong problem-solving ability
  • Have strong interpersonal and consultative skills.

Job Description for SME - GIS :

• Perform any GIS tasks allocated as per project requirements like., GIS database preparation, cleaning, and standardization, digitisation, editing, and spatial data analysis

• Good knowledge in Georeferencing, and Geo-Tagging

• Perform GIS based Hydrological data preparation and analysis using ArcGIS

• Capture the ground truth information based on the plans and digital sources provided and perform various analysis on satellite data

• Integration of non-spatial (tabular) data with GIS layer

• Perform various image processing techniques for open-source microwave and Optical satellite data and GIS analysis to bring out the meaningful information and results as per the project requirements

• Perform flood map preparation using microwave and optical satellite data

• Knowledge in Crop classification using Microwave and optical satellite data

• Knowledge in Agriculture field and on various crop phenology is preferable

• Should have excellent knowledge in ArcMap packages, ERDAS Imagine, QGIS

• Should have basin knowledge of programming and running existing script using Python

• Knowledge in Google Earth Engine is preferable

Location – Hyderabad

Internship – 3 months

Eligibility – Master's geomatics, remote sensing and GIS, agriculture, geography, earth science, or related field

Mode of work – Work from Office (Both Internship & Full-time)

Recruitment Process:-

1st level – Case Study

2nd level – Technical Interview

3rd level – Technical Interview

job_description:
What You’ll Do

As an Applied AI engineer, you will work closely with our pre- and post-sales Customer Experience team by developing solutions over the core platform via applications written in TypeScript, JavaScript, Python etc. You will be expected to employ your creativity and expertise to ideate and shape how AI, analytics and workflows are used in customers' processes.

Objectives for this role will include:

● Design, develop and implement integrations, automations and customizations to integrate QK offerings with customers’ tech stack and workflows, and ensure successful customer engagements.

● Utilize AI in novel ways to solve customer problems, including Generative AI techniques like prompt engineering for foundation large language models (LLMs) to enable great AI agent experience.

● Work on semantic search engine fine-tuning for better search accuracy.

● Conduct data analysis, write SQL queries, and build dashboards to share insights and drive decision-making.

● Be proactive in communicating and keeping constant feedback loops to all key stakeholders incl. Customers, Engineering, Product, Customer Success & Support, Revenue, Marketing.

● Learn new tools and guide customers through critical workflows, e.g. integration with code repositories

● Build Snap-ins, workflows, AirSync and AI Agents.

Ideal Candidate Qualifications:

● Software engineering degree or equivalent educational or professional experience.

● Hands-on coding experience using TypeScript/JavaScript, Python, APIs, Webhooks, SQL.

● Familiarity with Generative AI technologies including models like GPT-4, prompt engineering and fine-

tuning.

● Knowledge of vector databases and data embeddings.

● Outstanding communication (written and verbal in English).

● Result-oriented work style, ability to get things done and a learning mindset.

● An endless passion for challenging work that requires high energy, full engagement and a self-founded need for high performance.
