job_description:
JAVIS is looking for a Machine Learning Engineer I (Vision AI) who will build cutting-edge computer vision and multimodal AI capabilities that power the next generation of enterprise automation. You will work on extracting intelligence from images, documents, videos, and real-world visual data to transform how companies operate.

Responsibilities:

  • Source, clean, and pre-process image, video, and document datasets for computer vision model development
  • Design, implement, and train vision-based models using techniques such as CNNs, Vision Transformers (ViT), OCR, object detection, and multimodal architectures
  • Build and optimize multimodal workflows that combine vision, language, and structured data to automate enterprise use cases
  • Deploy vision models into production using cloud platforms, containers, or serverless architectures, ensuring scalability and resilience
  • Evaluate models using appropriate metrics (IoU, mAP, accuracy, latency, robustness, etc.) and iterate for performance improvements
  • Monitor model performance in production, fine-tune models as needed, and ensure they scale with increasing data and enterprise workloads
  • Collaborate with other members of the AI Team to integrate visual intelligence into broader AI systems

Requirements:

  • Solid understanding of machine learning, deep learning fundamentals and computer vision concepts
  • Proficiency in Python, with hands-on experience in PyTorch, OpenCV, Hugging Face
  • Understanding of key vision architectures (CNNs, ViTs, OCR pipelines, detection models)
  • Must possess strong analytical, debugging, and problem-solving skills

job_description:
Job Summary:

We are seeking a highly skilled and innovative AI Product Developer to join our team and lead the

development of scalable, production-ready AI solutions. You will work at the intersection of software

engineering, machine learning, and product strategy to build intelligent systems that solve real-world

problems and align with business goals.

World is at the cusp of realizing "AI is new UI", this is in the continuum of computing systems evolution. Since

the earlier days of computing it was always "learning" to work with computers, be it using input devices, user

interface or logic organization of work. This typically lead us to design systems that followed the sequence of

input-process-output.

With the affordability of AI and ML systems we can now build solutions that start with data, derive conclusions

based on the data and learn from the decisions being taken to involve humans in process. This change will

enable systems to be autonomous, extremely responsive and limit human intervention to step needed.

We are looking for Engineers that can think in the new paradigm, reimagine experiences that will result from

this and build systems that can help in realizing the new age solutions.

Key Responsibilities:

Agentic AI developer

As a hands-on engineer, you will be expected to design AI native solutions. Build prototypes and MVPs to

showcase the viability of the concept and lay the foundation for build engineers to constructs the solution.

This will require you to have good understanding of the rapidly evolving AI ecosystem, appreciation for design

and finally hands-on programming skills to build the basic solution framework.

Typical Duties and Responsibilities

• Build end-to-end Gen AI solutions

• Develop, refine, and implement advanced Gen AI models and ensure the success development of

solution prototypes and MVPs

• Work with Engineering, business, compliance stake holders to prove the viability of the solution.

• Design and enable build engineers to scale the MVPs into full scale production grade solutions

• Utilize Python and other data manipulation languages proficiently to prepare and manipulate data.

• Understand the business requirements and translate into Gen AI solution design that successfully

meets the business objectives.

• Stay current with technical and industry developments and standards to ensure effective and

advanced applications of data analysis techniques and methodologies.

Required Skills and Experience

• Hands-on experience of building conventional applications in any of the modern programming

languages.

• Experience of Agentic AI/Generative AI solution design and implementation.

• Good communication, documentation and presentation skills.

• Experience with common data languages (e.g. Python, Scala) and data warehouses (e.g. Redshift,

BigQuery, Snowflake, Databricks)

• Aware of evolving trends and solutions landscape.

• Possess strong problem-solving and strategic thinking abilities.

Education

• Bachelor’s degree in computer science, computer engineering, or a related field

• Prior knowledge of software development. If showcase solutions available, then it is an added

advantage.

solutions with user needs.

container orchestration (Kubernetes).

  • Strong communication skills with the ability to work collaboratively in fast-paced teams

job_description:
As a Voice AI Engineer I, you will help build the next generation of voice-driven automation agents that power GENIE’s conversational interface. You’ll work on speech recognition, synthesis, intent detection, and multimodal understanding, integrating these capabilities with enterprise-grade systems to create seamless, human-like interactions.

You’ll also work on developing multimodal interfaces that seamlessly integrate voice, text, and visuals to deliver natural, conversational user experiences.

Responsibilities:

  • Design and develop real-time speech-to-text (ASR) and text-to-speech (TTS) pipelines optimized for low latency and high accuracy
  • Work on end-to-end voice agent frameworks, integrating speech models with LLMs for natural conversations
  • Build and fine-tune intent classification and dialogue management systems
  • Implement voice biometrics, emotion detection, and multilingual support for enterprise voice agents
  • Collaborate with AI and backend engineers to deploy scalable voice solutions across industries
  • Collaborate with frontend teams to design and implement intuitive voice + UI experiences, ensuring smooth transitions between spoken and visual interactions
  • Research and prototype cutting-edge models in speech enhancement, prompt-based voice synthesis, and audio understanding

Requirements:

  • Proficiency in Python and its libraries like PyTorch, TensorFlow or Transformers
  • Understanding of speech processing concepts such as ASR, TTS, NLU, NLP and signal processing fundamentals
  • Experience or coursework in audio feature extraction, acoustic modelling, or language modelling
  • Exposure to speech APIs (OpenAI Whisper, Coqui, Deepgram, etc.) or LLM-integrated voice frameworks is a plus

job_description:
Job Description – Engineer – R&D Electronics

This position is for the development of electronics for the UAV/UAS systems and their ecosystems.

The new hire will get exposure to working on world-class technologies in

  • Autopilot System and computer modules.
  • Battery Management Systems and Battery Packs.
  • Brushless Motors, associated Drives, and various motor control algorithms.
  • Wireless Communication Systems.
  • GNSS systems and associated technologies like PPK/RTK.
  • Smart Charging Systems for batteries.
  • Payloads and Opto-Electronic Systems. 
  • Programming Languages: C, Embedded C firmware programming


Job Description: Electronics Engineer

We are seeking a talented Electronics Engineer, preferably an IIT graduate, to join our team in developing cutting-edge electronics for UAV/UAS systems and their supporting ecosystems. This role offers the opportunity to work with world-class technologies in a dynamic and innovative environment.


Key Responsibilities:

As an Electronics Engineer, you will gain hands-on experience and contribute to the following areas:


  • Autopilot Systems & Computer Modules: Design and develop advanced autopilot systems and computer modules for UAVs.
  • Battery Management Systems & Battery Packs: Work on the development and optimization of efficient battery management systems and high-performance battery packs.
  • Brushless Motors & Motor Control: Design and implement control algorithms for brushless motors and their associated drives.
  • Wireless Communication Systems: Develop and integrate reliable wireless communication systems for UAVs.
  • GNSS Systems & Associated Technologies: Work with GNSS technologies, including PPK/RTK, to enhance navigation and positioning accuracy.
  • Smart Charging Systems: Develop smart charging solutions for batteries, ensuring efficient and safe energy management.
  • Payloads & Opto-Electronic Systems: Design and integrate advanced payloads and opto-electronic systems for UAVs.
  • Firmware Development: Utilize programming languages like C and Embedded C to develop firmware for UAV electronics.


Qualifications:

- Graduate from IIT with a focus on Electronics Engineering or a related discipline.

- Strong foundation in electronics design and development.

- Proficiency in C and Embedded C firmware programming.

- Hands-on experience or strong interest in UAV systems is a plus.


This position offers the opportunity to work on the forefront of UAV technology and contribute to the development of next-generation aerial systems.

job_description:
Job Description – Mechanical Engineer – R&D Mechanical 

This position is for the development of controls for the UAV and its payloads. Control Systems Engineer will create world-class control solutions which will enable UAV and its subsystems to address the complex and critical operational challenges that the customers face.

Joiner will get exposure to working on world-class technologies in

  • Develop practical and innovative mechanical designs.
  • Tightly integrated, high reliability electro-mechanical intelligent systems.
  • Experience in designing mechanical /robotic systems using very strong technical fundamentals. 
  • Knowledge of Strength of Materials, Structural Analysis, Vibrations, and isolation strategies. 
  • Rugged, all-weather, portable electro-mechanical system design
  • High precision multi-actuator control mechanisms
  • High density portable electronics enclosure design.
  • Small aero structures, high-performance plastics, composite materials.
  • Key Skills - Strength of Materials, Structural Analysis, Vibrations, and isolation strategies, Mechatronics with the ability to do system-level design and optimization


Join Our Team: Building the Future of UAV/UAS Technologies

  •  We are excited to visit your campus, continuing our tradition of recruiting talented minds who are eager to innovate in the field of Unmanned Aerial Vehicle (UAV) and Unmanned Aircraft Systems (UAS). Our organization, founded by IIT Bombay alumni and nurtured within IITB labs, is at the forefront of developing cutting-edge technologies that are transforming the UAV/UAS landscape.

 

About Us:

  • At IdeaForge, we specialize in creating world-class software and firmware solutions for UAV/UAS systems and their ecosystems. Our work is driven by innovation and excellence, and we take pride in pushing the boundaries of technology.

 

Job Description: Control Systems Engineer - UAV and Payload Development

  • We are seeking a highly skilled Control Systems Engineer to join our team in developing advanced control systems for Unmanned Aerial Vehicles (UAVs) and their associated payloads. In this role, you will be instrumental in crafting innovative control solutions that empower UAVs and their subsystems to tackle complex, mission-critical challenges faced by our clients.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Design and Development: Conceptualize and develop cutting-edge mechanical designs, pushing the boundaries of practical and innovative engineering.
  • Electro-Mechanical Integration: Engineer tightly integrated, high-reliability electro-mechanical systems with intelligent control capabilities.
  • Robotics and Mechanical Systems: Apply strong technical fundamentals to design sophisticated mechanical and robotic systems, ensuring optimal performance and reliability.
  • Structural and Material Expertise: Utilize deep knowledge in Strength of Materials, Structural Analysis, Vibrations, and isolation strategies to inform design decisions.
  • Rugged Design: Develop robust, all-weather, portable electro-mechanical systems designed to withstand harsh environmental conditions.
  • Precision Mechanisms: Design and implement high-precision, multi-actuator control mechanisms for critical applications.
  • Compact Electronics Enclosures: Innovate in the design of high-density, portable electronics enclosures that meet stringent performance and durability requirements.
  • Advanced Materials: Work with small aero structures, high-performance plastics, and composite materials to create state-of-the-art systems.

Required Skills and Expertise:

  • Strength of Materials: Proficiency in analyzing and applying material strength in various design contexts.
  • Structural Analysis: Expertise in conducting and interpreting structural analysis for mechanical systems.
  • Vibration and Isolation: Advanced understanding of vibration analysis and isolation strategies for mechanical and electro-mechanical systems.
  • Mechatronics: Strong capability in mechatronics, with a focus on system-level design, integration, and optimization.
  • This position offers a unique opportunity to work with world-class technologies, driving innovation in the UAV industry while solving some of the most pressing operational challenges in the field.

Why Join Us?

  • - Work on innovative technologies that define the future of UAV/UAS.
  • - Collaborate with industry experts and pioneers in the field.
  • - Contribute to projects with real-world impact.

Connect with Us:

  • Website:[https://ideaforgetech.com/aboutus]
  • LinkedIn:[https://www.linkedin.com/company/ideaforge/posts/?feedView=all]

 Join us in shaping the future of UAV/UAS technology!

job_description:
About the Company:

Fractal is one of the most prominent providers of Artificial Intelligence to Fortune

500® companies. Fractal's vision is to power every human decision in the enterprise, and

bring AI, engineering, and design to help the world's most admired companies.

Fractal's businesses include Crux Intelligence (AI driven business intelligence), Eugenie.ai (AI

for sustainability), Asper.ai (AI for revenue growth management)

and Senseforth.ai (conversational AI for sales and customer service). Fractal

incubated Qure.ai, a leading player in healthcare AI for detecting Tuberculosis and Lung

cancer.

Fractal currently has 5500+ employees across 16 global locations, including the United States,

UK, Ukraine, India, Singapore, and Australia. Fractal has been recognized as 'Great Workplace'

and 'India's Best Workplaces for Women' in the top 100 (large) category by The Great Place to

Work® Institute; featured as a leader in Customer Analytics Service Providers Wave™ 2021,

Computer Vision Consultancies Wave™ 2020 & Specialized Insights Service Providers Wave™

2020 by Forrester Research Inc., a leader in Analytics & AI Services Specialists Peak Matrix

2022 by Everest Group and recognized as an 'Honorable Vendor' in 2022 Magic Quadrant™ for

data & analytics by Gartner Inc. For more information, visit fractal.ai

About The Team

At Fractal, engineers do not just write code, they build intelligence. They design systems that

learn, reason, and act; systems that enable the next wave of Agentic and Generative AI for

global enterprises.

As an Engineer in our AI Platforms and Solutions team, you will build core AI infrastructure,

model orchestration layers, and agent frameworks that power Fractal’s decision-intelligence

ecosystem. Your work will go beyond products you will help create an ecosystem of selflearning

agents, scalable data systems, and intelligent experiences that reshape how

businesses think, decide, and act.

You’ll collaborate with Fractal’s AI researchers, product engineers, and FDE teams to translate

cutting-edge AI research into production-grade platforms such as our flagship Cogentiq. You

will work on systems that operationalize reasoning, autonomy, and intelligence at scale,

impacting millions of lives indirectly through our clients.

What You Will Do

• Design, develop, test, and scale core AI components, services, and infrastructure

forming the backbone of Fractal’s platforms and agent ecosystems.

• Engineer integrations between large language models (LLMs), reasoning engines, and

decision systems.

• Implement scalable microservices for agentic orchestration, context management, and

autonomous task execution.

• Collaborate across AI research, product, platform, and FDE teams to move from AI

concept to enterprise deployment, translating papers to production.

• Contribute to AI platform innovation, including observability, multi-agent

coordination, memory architectures, and AI workflow automation.

• Participate in AI innovation sprints and hackathons to build prototypes around

reasoning, tool use, and autonomous collaboration between agents.

• Review and optimize code, focusing on performance, scalability, and maintainability in

high-load distributed environments.

What You Bring

• Strong programming skills in one or more languages : Python, C++, Java, or Go with a

focus on clean, efficient, and scalable code.

• Deep understanding of data structures, algorithms, OS fundamentals, and

distributed systems.

• Demonstrated curiosity about AI/ML, Generative AI, and agentic system design

• Strong foundation in machine learning, LLMs, deep learning architectures,

reinforcement learning, or NLP pipelines.

• Experience with cloud-native AI systems (GCP, AWS, Azure), container orchestration

(Kubernetes), and distributed compute frameworks (Ray, Spark, etc.).

• Familiarity with LLM fine tuning, Reasoning model tuning, vector databases,

embeddings, RAG systems, and multi-agent orchestration.

job_description:
About Skyroot Aerospace

Skyroot Aerospace is India’s leading private space launch vehicle company, founded with the vision of “Opening Space for All.” We are pioneering India’s private space revolution by developing cutting-edge launch vehicle technologies that enable cost-effective and reliable access to space. Our team is driven by innovation, technical excellence, and a shared passion for space exploration and engineering breakthroughs.

Role Overview - (Mechanical/ Aerospace / Industrial Engineering)

We are looking for highly motivated engineering graduates to join our growing engineering teams. You will work on challenging, multidisciplinary projects that contribute directly to the design, development, testing, and production of next-generation space systems.

This opportunity offers a platform to apply core engineering knowledge to real-world aerospace applications, working alongside some of the best minds in the industry.

 

Roles and Responsibilities

  • Participate in design, analysis, and validation of engineering systems and components.
  • Support development, manufacturing, integration, and testing activities across multiple domains.
  • Work collaboratively with cross-functional teams to solve complex engineering challenges.
  • Contribute to continuous improvement, optimization, and innovation in product development.
  • Ensure compliance with aerospace quality, safety, and reliability standards.

 

Must-Have Qualifications

  • B.Tech / B.E. (Final year or recent graduate) in Mechanical, Aerospace, Aeronautical, or Industrial Engineering.
  • Core Engineering Fundamentals:

a.     Mechanical Engineering: Mechanics of Materials, Vibrations, Thermodynamics, Heat and Mass Transfer, Turbomachinery

b.     Aerospace / Aeronautical Engineering: Flight Dynamics, Aerodynamics, Propulsion, Aerospace Structures

c.      Industrial Engineering: Operations Research, Supply Chain Management

  • Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities
  • Proficiency in programming languages such as Python, C/C++ for data analysis, automation, and simulation scripting
  • Proficiency in CAD and engineering analysis/simulation software
  • Excellent teamwork, communication, and a proactive learning attitude
  • Genuine passion for aerospace and innovation-driven engineering

 

Why Join Skyroot Aerospace?

  • Be part of India’s first private company to build and launch space vehicles.
  • Work on end-to-end development of real space systems with a young and dynamic team.
  • Mentorship from experienced engineers and scientists, including ISRO alumni.
  • Collaborative, high-growth environment where your ideas and work have real impact.

 

Location: Hyderabad, Telangana

Employment Type: Full-time

Eligible Disciplines: Mechanical / Aerospace / Aeronautical / Industrial Engineering

 Role Overview - Avionics Engineering

We are seeking highly motivated and technically strong graduates to join our Avionics team. You will work on end-to-end development of flight-critical electronic systems, embedded software, and electrical integration that power our space launch vehicles.

This role provides an exceptional opportunity to apply your electronics and software expertise to real-world aerospace applications in a fast-paced, innovation-driven environment.

Roles and Responsibilities

  • Contribute to the design and development of embedded systems, electronics hardware, and software for flight and ground systems.
  • Work on hardware design, PCB development, firmware programming, and system testing.
  • Support integration and validation of avionics systems including sensors, controllers, and power distribution.
  • Participate in data acquisition, telemetry, and control system development for launch vehicles.
  • Collaborate across teams (mechanical, propulsion, systems) to ensure seamless system-level performance.
  • Ensure compliance with aerospace quality, safety, and reliability standards.

 

Must-Have Qualifications

  • B.Tech / B.E. (Final Year or Recent Graduate) in Electronics and Communication, Electrical, or Instrumentation Engineering.
  • Strong fundamentals in electronics, control systems, embedded systems, and circuit design.
  • Proficiency in C/C++ or Python, and exposure to microcontrollers, FPGAs, or embedded platforms.
  • Knowledge of electrical schematics, PCB tools, or simulation software (MATLAB, LTSpice, etc.).
  • Strong analytical, problem-solving, and debugging skills.
  • Excellent teamwork, communication, and a passion for technology and aerospace innovation.

Why Join Skyroot Aerospace?

  • Work on cutting-edge avionics that power India’s private space missions.
  • Collaborate with experienced engineers, scientists, and ISRO alumni.
  • Opportunity to see your designs and code literally take flight.
  • A learning-driven, collaborative culture focused on engineering excellence and innovation.

 

Location: Hyderabad, Telangana

Employment Type: Full-time

Eligible Disciplines: Electronics and Communication / Electrical / Instrumentation Engineering

 

Role Overview - Mission & GNC

We are seeking highly motivated and technically strong graduates to join our Mission and Guidance, Navigation & Control (GNC) teams. You will work on end-to-end development of Trajectory design, GNC algorithms, flight software and perform various mission studies for launch vehicles.

This role provides an exceptional opportunity to apply your flight dynamics, control system design, sensor fusion and electronics expertise to real-world aerospace applications in a fast-paced, innovation-driven environment.

Roles and Responsibilities

  • Work on the design and development of Launch Vehicle Mission design, GNC algorithms and software, six Degree of Freedom launch vehicle models and mission simulations.
  • Support integration and validation of GNC software in the flight computer through simulations and ground tests.
  • Perform mission studies to ensure the robustness of the software and safety of the launch vehicle.
  • Collaborate across teams (mechanical, propulsion, avionics) to ensure seamless system-level performance.
  • Ensure compliance with aerospace quality, safety, and reliability standards.

Must-Have Qualifications

  • B.Tech / B.E. (Final Year or Recent Graduate) in Aerospace Engineering, Electrical and Electronics Engineering or Instrumentation and Control Engineering.
  • Strong fundamentals in flight mechanics, control systems, sensor fusion and embedded software development.
  • Proficiency in C/C++, MATLAB and Python, and exposure to microcontrollers, FPGAs, or embedded platforms.
  • Strong analytical, problem-solving, and debugging skills.
  • Excellent teamwork, communication, and a passion for technology and aerospace innovation.

Why Join Skyroot Aerospace?

  • Work on cutting-edge Mission Design and GNC systems that power India’s private space missions.
  • Collaborate with experienced engineers, scientists, and ISRO alumni.
  • Opportunity to see your designs and code literally take flight.
  • A learning-driven, collaborative culture focused on engineering excellence and innovation.

 

Location: Hyderabad, Telangana

Employment Type: Full-time

Eligible Disciplines: Aerospace Engineering/ Electrical and Electronics Engineering/ Instrumentation and Control Engineering.

job_description:

·Design, develop and evaluate statistical, machine learning and generative AI / LLM models to understand driving risk, driver coaching and actionable insights.

·Build machine learning models and design product features to improve scores, compliance, and other key metrics.

·Develop, deploy and improve machine learning models in end-to-end ML pipeline for key features such as accident prediction.

·Design efficient architecture for real-time edge computing.

·Conduct statistical experiments, A/B Testing, and data-driven metrics to guide product ROI features.

·Work with the data engineering/ cloud team/ product team to productize data science features or microservices.

·B.Tech/M. Tech in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, or other Quantitative Fields.

·Strong knowledge of statistics, probability, ML, and estimation theory.

·Good understanding of data-structures and algorithms.

·Experience with deriving useful insights from large and complex datasets.

·Experience with Mathematical/Statistical modeling, data visualization, and storytelling.

·Strong ability to communicate highly technical results to a diverse audience.

·Ability to develop quick proof of concept solutions in a fast-paced startup environment.

·Good hands-on experience of coding – Python (required), C/C++, R, etc.

·Experience working with databases – Postgres, MongoDB, etc.

profile: Associate Engineer: Battery Test and Analysis
job_description:
At Caterpillar, we're working to help our customers build a better world.

We wouldn't be the Caterpillar we are today without the exceptionally talented, bright, and driven people who get the job done. This is your chance to help us make progress possible around the world - for our customers, for growing communities and for every member of our team. We are looking for a dynamic, organized and self-starter engineer to join our Power Systems & Controls Development (PS&CD) team. As an Associate Engineer, you will serve as an individual contributor on complex and exciting projects that will support Electrification and (EAPS). developing, implementing, and documenting standard technical test instructions used in the validation and development of Battery System technologies. Day- to-day work will involve converting test plans to test instructions, collaborating with lab engineers in the lab to execute testing, analyzing the data, and evaluating the performance against success criteria which will ultimately be used in making product decisions.

You will be responsible for eveloping and maintaining accurate single-line diagrams for various test setups that will consist of battery cells, battery modules, battery strings/packs, battery simulators, DC-DC converters, etc. This development and testing work is dynamic and fast-paced with opportunities to grow and develop.

job_description:
Founded in 2003, GAIN Credit is a tech-forward, inclusive, and responsible business using world-class innovative technology and data science to provide endless gaining opportunities for customers, employees, and merchants alike. At GAIN Credit, our mission is to empower lives, which is about providing solutions that meet the credit needs of society in an affordable and responsible manner, ensuring that we always treat customers fairly, helping our customers when they need it most by providing access to credit and giving them realistic timelines to re-pay.

Our flagship brands – Lending Stream & Drafty – enjoy 4.4 & 4.3 ratings on TrustPilot respectively (UK’s leading customer review website). Drafty – our

pioneering credit-line product – is a first-of-its-kind, no-fee credit line and has been awarded ‘Innovation of the Year’ for 2017 and 2018 by the Consumer Credit Awards.

In India, we are among the top 55 Great places to work. People at GAIN Credit – ‘GAINers’ as we call them – are our assets. We believe happy people lead to happy customers. And this is why a great work culture is a super high priority at GAIN Credit. We make that happen through living our company values in every interaction we have with each other. In fact, we believe the only way to ‘gain’ at GAIN Credit is through living our company values.

Some of our awards:


  • Best Short-Term Loan Provider – Consumer Credit Awards 2025
  • Ranked 55 among India Great places to work (mid-sized segment) in 2021- 22
  • Best Responsible Lender at Credit Excellence Awards- 2021
  • 2018 British Credit Award- Consumer Credit Team of the Year- Lending Stream
  • F5: Alternative Consumer Lender of the Year – Lending Stream
  • F5 Awards 2018 Best Brand – Drafty
  • 2018 Consumer Credit Awards: Innovation of the Year – Drafty

To know more about us:


  • Website: www.gaincredit.com
  • LinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/company/gaincredit/mycompany/

Is this the place for you?

As a GAINer, you will get to focus on your personal and professional gains, experience an award-winning workplace culture, access to perks, maintain work-life balance, and contribute to the community in meaningful ways. As a GAINer, integrity will guide everything you do, with a service mindset that puts others first. You will foster curiosity to drive learning, focus on continuous improvement, and take accountability for your actions to deliver exceptional outcomes.

We strongly believe in:

At GAIN Credit, we believe that our fantastic teams help build the best products that enable us to understand and attract more customers. Therefore, we completely support and welcome diversity across thoughts, people, and actions. We care about our employees, and their well-being and have many on-going activities to boost their physical, mental, and financial wellbeing. We encourage people from diverse backgrounds, culture, age, gender, orientation, and abilities to apply for all our openings and offer reasonable support to achieve their professional goals.

job_description:
Role: Data Scientist

KANTAR IS THE WORLD’S LEADING DATA, INSIGHTS AND CONSULTING COMPANY.

KANTAR is the world's leading insights, consulting, and analytics company. We understand how people think, feel, shop, share, vote, and view

more than anybody else. With over 25,000 people, we combine the best of human understanding with advanced technologies to help the world's

leading organizations, succeed and grow.

For more details visit our page: http://www.kantar.com

Business Overview:

The Global Data Science and Innovation (DSI) unit of KANTAR, nested within its Analytics Practice (https://www.kantar.com/expertise/analytics),

is a fast-growing team of niche, elite data scientists responsible for all data science led innovation within KANTAR. The unit has a strong internal and external reputation with global stakeholders and clients, of handling sophisticated cutting-edge analytics, using state-of-the-art techniques and deep mathematical / statistical rigor. The unit is responsible for bringing in a lot of latest developments in the field of Machine Learning, AI, Deep Learning, Computer Vision, NLP, Optimization, etc. to solve complex business problems in marketing analytics and consulting and build products that empower our colleagues around the world.

Job Profile Summary:

As part of a high-profile team, the position offers a unique opportunity to work first-hand on some of the most unique, exciting, and challenging projects within the organization, and be part of a fast-paced, entrepreneurial environment. One gets to work on and influence cutting-edge work with peers from top universities from India, US, and other parts of the world.

You will be constantly learning and trying out new things, dealing with complex technical problems, thinking on first principles, using the latest in the fields of Data Science. You don’t need to know everything yet, but you DO need to have a passion for learning and the flexibility and stamina to do so. You should be able to quickly bring several creative technical ideas to fruition - knowing fully well some may work, and some won’t.

You need to be flexible, work well in teams, own your work, and be a good collaborator. Nothing gets done in isolation at Kantar. As such, you need to be a fast learner, a very good problem solver, and an incredibly good coder. These skills are arguably more important than the specific methodologies or technologies that you may know.

If this sounds like you, we look forward to meeting you soon at your campus

Job Details:

✓ Designation: Data Scientist

✓ CTC -18.5 LPA (fixed) + Relocation as per Kantar's Domestic Relocation Policy

✓ Location: Chennai

Detailed Job Description:

Candidate will be responsible for the following.

✓ Application of sophisticated data science techniques to address a variety of business / marketing problems.

✓ Build, implement, deploy, and maintain state-of-the-art statistical models including machine learning, text analytics, computer vision,

Generative AI etc. across many different industries.

✓ Work with any kind of data - structured (CRM, survey, billing, behavioral etc.) or unstructured (text, image, audio, video etc.).

Using software such as R, Python, SAS, Gauss etc. to analyze different kinds of data (structured or unstructured).

✓ Should be able to appreciate high-level business objectives, and how that translates to technical questions, and execute with efficiency and

impact.

✓ Interpreting results of quantitative analyses and creating recommendations that link modelling results to business issues.

✓ Collaborate in a multi-functional team (dev ops, data engineers, front-end developers, cloud architects, operations, researchers, and product

owners) and diverse global stakeholders to develop scalable processes and protocols for executing analytics at scale.

✓ Attitudinally entrepreneurial, willing to try out new things, explore. Keep abreast of latest developments in the industry and bring in those

learnings from allied fields into our context.

Expected Skills and Proficiencies:

✓ 0 to 3 years’ experience with strong written and verbal communication skills. Meticulous and deep attention to detail.

✓ Proficiency in programming is a must (R / Python at least at an intermediate level). More than the libraries you have used, we are interested in

your ability to develop solutions and translate ideas into code quickly and effectively.

✓ A healthy mix of strong technical depth in data science, as well as consultative capabilities preferred – (we are a technical team, so your

technical competence will be given more weightage!).

✓ Knowledge / Experience in building applications on cloud platforms like Azure/AWS/Google Cloud using serverless architecture is an added

advantage.

✓ In general, a natural ability to learn and deploy new technologies in the field of Data Science, cloud computing, and application development.

✓ Strong statistics background would be a distinct advantage. Some database background (SQL, Hadoop etc.) will be an added advantage.

✓ Be able to appreciate ‘big picture’ and business perspective along with strong focus on execution.

Why join Kantar?

We shape the brands of tomorrow by better understanding people everywhere. By understanding people, we can understand what drives their

decisions, actions, and aspirations on a global scale. And by amplifying our in-depth expertise of human understanding alongside groundbreaking

technology, we can help brands find concrete insights that will help them succeed in our fast-paced, ever shifting world.

And because we know people, we like to make sure our own people are being looked after as well. Equality of opportunity for everyone is our

highest priority and we support our colleagues to work in a way that supports their health and wellbeing. While we encourage teams to spend

part of their working week in the office, we understand no one size fits all; our approach is flexible to ensure everybody feels included,

accepted, and that we can win together. We’re dedicated to creating an inclusive culture and value the diversity of our people, clients, suppliers

and communities, and we encourage applications from all backgrounds and sections of society. Even if you feel like you’re not an exact match,

we’d love to receive your application and talk to you about this job or others at Kantar.

Operational Risk etc.

About Us: (www.auronova.in)

Auronova Consulting is a specialized Risk Management Consulting firm providing cutting edge financial consulting

to BFSI segments inclusive of central banks, banks, fintech, investment banks, PE Firms, insurance firms, brokerage,

fintech, non-banking finance companies and other financial institutions. We cover the entire Risk Management

spectrum from Credit risk, Market risk and Operational risk along with regulatory consulting like Basel II/III, IFRS 9,

FRTB, ICAAP, Stress Testing etc. We have served 100+ clients in multiple countries across the globe over the last 10

years with more than 200+ engagements in risk, analytics & compliance area, creating a niche for ourselves by

providing our clients best in class solutions, while competing with the best in the industry. Our unique value

proposition is to help our clients in designing and implementing a comprehensive analytics program customized to

their requirements. We have gained valuable experience over time while working with leading banks and financial

institutions across the globe.

You are aware that life as a consultant is challenging and, at times, extremely demanding. Our customers and our
employees are our most important asset, and you are ready to do what it takes to generate good relations, both

make a difference. Your communication skills are outstanding, and your written and spoken English are fluent.

company for all outside India stay projects.

job_description:
Title : HVDC Control & Protection Engineer

Snapshot of Your Day

As an HVDC Control and Protection Engineer in an HVDC project, you will be involved in multiple

topics over the duration of the project. Your tasks will include the definition of control and

protection concepts, execution of DC protection coordination studies, implementation and

verification of the control logic in MATLAB/SIMULINK according to customer requirements and

finally performing tests to verify the final performance.

This role provides an opportunity to engage with diverse facets of HVDC system development.

You will collaborate with engineers from other systems, such as Human-Machine Interface,

Switchyard control, and real-time simulation, within the project team. Additionally, you will

actively participate in discussions with customers, contributing to shaping the new electrical grid

that will pave the way for a sustainable future.

How You’ll Make an Impact

• Develop DC protection concepts for HVDCs of different applications

• Perform DC protection coordination studies with EMTDC / PSCAD

• Program the software of DC protection and Measurement System in MATLAB/SIMULINK

and Pluscontrol platform

• Design and implement open- and closed-loop control systems for HVDC Converter

Systems

• Implement control software in MATLAB/SIMULINK and verify using software-in-the-loop

(SIL) and hardware-in-the-loop (HIL) test environments

• Contribute to the clarification of technical requirements within project teams as well as with

customers

What You Bring

• Master’s degree in electrical engineering, automation engineering or comparable field of

study

• Experience in software engineering and testing

• Very good knowledge of MATLAB/SIMULINK - ideally in connection with RTDS

• Knowledge in modelling and simulation studies with the industrial power system program

PSCAD/EMTDC

• Basic knowledge in converter technology as well as in open- and closed-loop controls

• Eagerness to work in a team, to learn, and to contribute to the energy transition

• Fluent in English, spoken and written, German is a plus
ctc_inr: 14.5 LPA+1.5 lakh joining Bonus with clawback of 2 years

job_description:
Title : Substation Control & Protection Engineer

What You’ll Do

• Engineering of Protection, Control and Automation system for High Voltage and Extra High

Voltage transmission substations.

• Understand and analyze single-line diagrams, tripping philosophy and protection schemes.

• Assist in developing protection and automation solutions for global and local projects.

• Support design of protection panels, metering systems, and communication interfaces.

• Learn to configure protection relays (Make - Siemens, SEL, GE, Hitachi etc.) using tools like

DIGSI, MiCom, PCM600 etc.

• Configuration of substation automation system of various OEMs like Siemens, Hitachi, GE, Zenon

Copa Data.

• Perform protection relay setting, current transformer (CT) / voltage transformer (VT) calculations

• Assist in developing schemes and project documents using CAD Tools.

• Participate in Factory Acceptance Testing and documentation processes.

• Collaborate with cross-functional teams during project execution and commissioning.

What You’ll Learn

This position requires a bachelor’s degree or equivalent with background in Electrical Engineering.

• Real-world application of protection and control engineering in substations.

• Industry standards like ANSI and IEC.

• Tools and technologies used in modern grid automation.

• Working in a collaborative, multi-disciplinary engineering environment.

What We Value

• Strong academic background in electrical engineering or power systems.

• Curiosity to learn and apply new technologies.

• Good communication and teamwork skills.

• Basic understanding of protection relays and substation automation is a plus.

job_description:
GKN Aerospace India Graduate Programme is a 15 months rotation program targeted on recruiting and developing Engineering graduates through phased learning and helping individuals to set their own goals and explore own interests within our business while being fully supported.

The phase wise learning shall give you an opportunity to understand and develop both your technical and personal Skills. While on this program, you work on real time projects, solving real world problems and delivering a real change. Program provides a development opportunity and mentoring to match your capabilities and aspirations to GKN strategic and operational needs – ensuring a thriving business for GKN and a fulfilling career for you at our offices.

Key accountabilities

As a young graduate at GKN, we want you to be interested in working with Design engineering, technology and product development or product support, either in Analysis / definition/ Product design. You are accountable for your own personal and professional growth under the guidance of our senior teams. You will be building relationships within and outside GKN Aerospace and maintaining performance within your team and the wider company. There will also be self-development through trainings and other opportunities and the organisation will support you through mentoring alongside their placements.

Specific accountabilities will vary between job families, however you will be responsible for supporting functional and operational teams and their projects, such as implementation of Strategic Initiatives, Organisation KPI, Lean culture, Innovations, Industry 4.0 etc.

As you develop the confidence and competence on the project/programme you can begin to take ownership for portions of larger projects under supervision from their line manager and/or placement manager.

The precise nature of each your role will be defined by the skills and competencies developed, interests and the needs of the business.


Essential:

Post-graduation degree from reputed university preferably from Mechanical, Industrial Production and Aerospace background

Excellent engineering fundamentals

Passion to drive their own career and Willingness to Learn

Keen interest in the Aerospace industry

Enthusiasm for continuous personal development

Exhibits leadership potential and Ownership

Good communication skills in English both oral and written

Right to work in country that you have applied for

Develop and sustain a healthy work relationship based on mutual trust with peers, internal and external stakeholders

Self-driven individual who can expand his/her skills with on-job training

LEAN culture and mind-set

Flexible and adaptable to new tasks

Knowledge of Gas turbine working principle

Knowledge of any programing languages

job_description:
AI Engineer – Building AI Agents & Scalable Infrastructure (Campus Hiring)

We’re looking for curious builders and innovators — students who love solving real problems, learning fast, and pushing boundaries in the world of AI. This is your chance to work on cutting-edge AI agent technology and gain hands-on experience that few internships or entry-level roles can match.

You’ll join a small, high-impact team working on next-generation AI systems — designing the intelligence and infrastructure that enables agents to reason, plan, and act to solve complex problems at scale.

 

Why this role is different (and why it’s a great learning opportunity)

This isn’t just about connecting APIs to LLMs — it’s about building the core intelligence that powers the next era of AI.

·      Learn to design and build AI agents that can reason, plan, and take actions autonomously.

·       Architect and implement advanced agent systems with memory, feedback, and orchestration layers.

·       Navigate open-ended, ambiguous problems where creativity and experimentation are key.

·       Work directly with mentors who have deep experience in ML infrastructure, AI design, and scalable deployment.

 

What you’ll do

·       Contribute to agentic AI projects from idea to prototype and production.

·       Design systems for retrieval, reasoning, and adaptive learning.

·       Collaborate with researchers and senior engineers to bring new AI ideas to life.

·       Experiment, learn, and build — this is a hands-on, high-growth environment designed for learning by doing.

Who should apply

·       People with strong foundations in machine learning, AI, or distributed systems.

·       A passion for continuous learning, exploring new AI frameworks, and applying them to real-world problems.

·       Comfort with fast-changing, ambiguous environments.

·       Prior experience with AI projects (academic, open-source, or internships) is a plus but not required — curiosity and initiative matter most.

Why join us

·       Build AI systems that tackle problems others shy away from.

·       Learn directly from experts in ML infrastructure and AI systems.

·       Work on impactful, real-world challenges while building a portfolio that shows what you can do — not just what you’ve studied.

·       Graduate with practical experience, mentorship, and credibility that set you apart in the AI job market.

job_description:
Data Science

Chennai

Who we are

Tiger Analytics is a global leader in AI and analytics, helping Fortune 1000 companies solve their toughest challenges. We offer full-stack AI and analytics services & solutions to empower businesses to achieve real outcomes and value at scale. We are on a mission to push the boundaries of what AI and analytics can do to help enterprises navigate uncertainty and move forward decisively. Our purpose is to provide certainty to shape a better tomorrow.

Our team of 4000+ technologists and consultants are based in the US, Canada, the UK, India, Singapore, and Australia, working closely with clients across CPG, Retail, Insurance, BFS, Manufacturing, Life Sciences, and Healthcare. Many of our team leaders rank in the Top 10 and 40 Under 40 lists, exemplifying our dedication to innovation and excellence.

We are a Great Place to Work-Certified™ (2022-25), recognized by analyst firms such as Forrester, Gartner, HFS, Everest, ISG, and others. We have been ranked among the ‘Best’ and ‘Fastest Growing’ analytics firms lists by Inc., Financial Times, Economic Times, and Analytics India Magazine.

Curious about the role? What your typical day would look like?

As a Trainee - Analyst you will work on a broad range of cutting-edge data analytics and machine learning problems across a variety of industries. More specifically, you will:

● Engage with clients to understand their business context

● Translate business problems and technical constraints into technical requirements for the desired analytics solutions.

What do we expect?

● Proficient in Programming – Python/C/C++

● Strong verbal and written communication

● BE / B. Tech from a CS/IT/Circuit stream is mandatory

● No active backlogs

You are important to us, let’s stay connected!

Every individual comes with a different set of skills and qualities so even if you don’t tick all the boxes for the role today, we urge you to apply as there might be a suitable/unique role for you tomorrow. We are an equal opportunity employer. Our diverse and inclusive culture and values guide us to listen, trust, respect, and encourage people to grow the way they desire.

Note: The designation will be commensurate with expertise and experience. Compensation packages are among the best in the industry.

Additional Benefits: Health insurance (self & family), virtual wellness platform, and knowledge communities.

IDFC FIRST Bank's core philosophy follows a customer centric promise Always You First. The bank aspires to provide high quality financial solutions for emerging India, while keeping customer at the core.

About your future dream team:

Our team is pivotal for delivering the vision – Always You First. This team acts as a center of excellence to provide accurate and timely insights and data driven solutions to drive personalized and innovative product offerings to our customers.

At IDFC First bank, we know that not everyone can bring all the skills & experiences to the table, therefore, we are more focused on people bringing a growth mindset to their approach to work. Learning on the job is the way we work, so don’t worry if don’t have all!

We work closely with all business units (product, sales), functional stakeholders (e.g. credit, operations, Journey Excellence), technology teams (IT team and vendors) and external partners (e.g. DSAs, agencies) to create and deliver competitive advantage and quantifiable impact on the Bank’s performance.

Also, to add, we not only work with traditional data environment of relational databases, SQL/SAS but also in AWS using PySpark, Sagemaker and other Auto – ML tools like Altair.

The Purpose

The Data Analyst role –

  • Identifies business needs
  • Builds advanced analytical ML & DL tools
  • Develop test strategies
  • Supports Senior Analysts & Lead Analyst in delivering business outcome

Areas that play to your strengths

All the responsibilities we’ll trust you with –

  • Identify and scope business requirements and priorities through rigorous information gathering and analysis as well as clarification of the solutions, initiatives and programs to enable effective delivery.
  • Design analytics techniques to meet current and future business needs.
  • Robust understanding of data and fields required or analysis.
  • Understanding of analytical framework and map it with data available
  • Develop a test strategy and systematic test procedures to verify and ensure that solution meets its design specifications
  • Develop, select and apply algorithms and advanced computational methods to enable systems to learn, improve, adapt and produce desired outcomes or tasks.
  • Displays the ability to approach existing situations and problems in a new manner and creates innovative solutions
  • Challenges the status quo to bring about continuous improvement in performance, drives changes that would have a positive impact on the organization
  • Works to achieve goals and objectives and shows a strong drive to follow through and complete what was started.
  • Recognizes the complex interrelationships among business activities and understands the "big picture" of how decisions impact the overall business, outcomes and processes
  • Has an innate orientation to be aware of how one contributes to the larger vision of the Bank

Things we’ll like about you!

  •  You love problem solving, you have excellent communication skills and you are action oriented (you like doing stuff, not just thinking or talking about them)
  • You can work with unstructured problem statements (like estimating how many square feet of pizza is consumed in India in a day without looking it up on the internet)
  • You get excited at the prospect of working with large volumes of data and enjoy coding!
  • You are open to learning continuously – irrespective of whether it is a new technology, a new algorithm or a new business!
  • You know when to look things up on the internet!
bond_details: If Employee resign before completing one year, he/she will have to pay INR 1 Lakh towards training expenses
skill_set: Data Analysis, AL/ML, Machine Learning, deep learning

job_description:
BCR (Barco Control Rooms) 

The Barco Control Rooms business unit is making workflow and visualization solutions for the Control Room market since 1994 to help operators collect, visualize and share critical information for optimal mission-critical decision making. Today, we are still the number one choice for control room professionals who want to stay on top of their situational awareness with 12000+ installations for critical infrastructure and critical operations. 

Barco CTRL is our latest flagship software product. It is a simple, scalable and secure platform, that gives an operator full control over the information flow in an easy and intuitive way for faster and efficient decision making. 

 Software Development Engineer at Barco NOIDA 

As Software Development Engineer (SDE), you will be part of a dynamic team responsible for designing, developing features and software applications for the control room product that provide exceptional user experiences. You will work on Full stack technologies, contributing to the full software development lifecycle. You will have exposure to collaborate and work with global teams and grow in a fast-paced environment on the latest technology and provide innovative solutions. 

Key Responsibilities: 

  • Design and Development: Collaborate with cross-functional teams to design, develop features and applications using latest tech stack. 
  • Full Stack Development: Writing Clean Code and create responsive and user-friendly interfaces and scalable backend using Angular, React, NodeJs, Express, Python, NestJs
  • Database Management: Design and manage databases (SQL/NoSQL) to ensure efficient data storage and retrieval. 
  • Testing and Debugging: Test-driven development - write unit, component and integration tests to ensure code quality, and debug and resolve issues. 
  • Automation testing with tools and frameworks such as Python, Selenium, Cucumber, and Robot Framework
  • Collaboration: Work closely with product managers, designers, and other developers to deliver high-quality products on time. 
  • Continuous Learning: Stay updated with the latest industry trends, technologies, and best practices to continuously improve skills and knowledge. 
  • Mentorship: Get mentored by the product and technical experts for the growth and development  

·      Exhibit critical thinking mindset by constructively challenging the status quo and proposing creative solutions to enhance product quality and development processes.

  • Write clean, efficient, and maintainable code following industry best practices.
  • Participate in code reviews and contribute to improving code quality and team standards.
  • Debug and resolve technical issues reported in testing or production environments.
  • Continuously learn and adapt to new technologies, tools, and development methodologies.

Required Skills

  • Strong understanding of Computer Science fundamentals — Data Structures, Algorithms, and Object-Oriented Programming.
  • Proficiency in at least one programming language (e.g., Java, Python, C++, JavaScript, or Go).
  • Basic understanding of web technologies, databases, and software development life cycle.
  • Good problem-solving, analytical, and debugging skills.
  • Ability to work in a team environment and communicate effectively.

Good to Have

● Exposure to frameworks like React, Node.js, SpringBoot, or Django.

● Experience with version control systems (Git/GitHub).

● Basic knowledge of cloud platforms (AWS, GCP, Azure)or containerization (Docker).

● Internship experience or project work in software development.


Education

● Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field.


What We Offer

● Mentorship and learning opportunities from experienced engineers.

● A collaborative, fast-paced, and growth-oriented work environment.

● Opportunity to work on challenging, high-impact projects.

● Competitive compensation and career development pathways.

job_description:
About RISA Labs

At RISA, we are building the future of mission-critical workflows by leveraging the latest in AI. Our purpose is to solve humanity’s hardest hurdles, and we are starting with the incredibly high-stakes challenges within oncology. We’re not just selling software; we are delivering a new kind of resilient, autonomous infrastructure that powers foundational institutions and ultimately helps accelerate human progress.

Founders

RISA was founded by Kshitij Jaggi and Kumar Shivang, IIT Kanpur alumni with a proven track record from their previous healthcare startup, Urban Health. Their vision is to streamline oncology care through cutting-edge technology.

Funding

RISA Labs is backed by $3.5 million in seed funding, led by Flipkart co-founder Binny Bansal, with support from Oncology Ventures, General Catalyst, z21 Ventures, Odd Bird VC, and angel investor Ashish Gupta.

The Opportunity

As an Associate Product Manager - Growth at RISA Labs, you will drive initiatives that fuel user acquisition, engagement, and retention across our product ecosystem. You’ll work at the intersection of product, marketing, and data - experimenting, learning, and scaling what works. This role is perfect for someone who thrives on metrics, experimentation, and building data-informed growth loops that create meaningful impact in healthcare AI adoption.

What You’ll do

  • Identify and execute growth opportunities across the funnel – from activation and engagement to retention and monetization
  • Design and run experiments (A/B tests, campaigns, and feature launches) to improve user conversion and adoption
  • Work cross-functionally with marketing, engineering, and analytics teams to design scalable growth systems and automation
  • Use data to uncover insights about user behavior, measure the impact of initiatives, and iterate quickly based on learnings.
  • Own growth metrics and dashboards – track performance, set targets, and drive measurable outcomes
  • Partner with Product and GTM teams to shape pricing, onboarding, and communication strategies for users and enterprise clients
  • Support leadership in building growth frameworks that can be replicated across future products and markets

What You’ll Bring

  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Information Technology, or a related field
  • Internships or projects) in growth, product analytics, marketing tech, or product management
  • Strong analytical mindset with familiarity in SQL, Google Analytics, or data visualization tools
  • Deep curiosity for user behavior, data-driven storytelling, and experimentation
  • Excellent communication and collaboration skills - comfortable working across teams and with leadership.
  • A bias for action and iteration - you enjoy testing, learning fast, and scaling what works.
  • Interest in healthcare, AI, or SaaS growth models is a plus
skill_set: Design and run experiments (A/B tests, campaigns, and feature launches) to improve user conversion and adoption

job_description:
About RISA Labs

At RISA, we are building the future of mission-critical workflows by leveraging the latest in AI. Our purpose is to solve humanity’s hardest hurdles, and we are starting with the incredibly high-stakes challenges within oncology. We’re not just selling software; we are delivering a new kind of resilient, autonomous infrastructure that powers foundational institutions and ultimately helps accelerate human progress.

Founders

RISA was founded by Kshitij Jaggi and Kumar Shivang, IIT Kanpur alumni with a proven track record from their previous healthcare startup, Urban Health. Their vision is to streamline oncology care through cutting-edge technology

Funding

RISA Labs is backed by $3.5 million in seed funding, led by Flipkart co-founder Binny Bansal, with support from Oncology Ventures, General Catalyst, z21 Ventures, Odd Bird VC, and angel investor Ashish Gupta.

The Opportunity

As a Product Designer at RISA Labs, you’ll play a key role in shaping the interfaces, interactions, and experiences that power the future of healthcare technology. You’ll work closely with product managers, engineers, and clinical experts to craft intuitive and elegant designs that solve complex problems in simple, human ways. This is a great fit for someone who thrives on transforming deep tech and AI complexity into clear, meaningful user experiences that drive adoption and impact.

What You’ll do

  • Collaborate with Product and Engineering teams to translate product vision and user needs into clear design directions and experiences
  • Design intuitive user flows, wireframes, prototypes, and high-fidelity interfaces for complex healthcare and AI-driven products
  • Work closely with cross-functional partners to maintain consistency in design systems, patterns, and visual language
  • Conduct user research, usability testing, and feedback sessions to validate design decisions and improve usability.
  • Balance business goals, technical feasibility, and user empathy to craft thoughtful, scalable solutions
  • Contribute to the evolution of RISA’s design language - ensuring simplicity, clarity, and accessibility across all touchpoints
  • Stay updated with emerging tools, trends, and best practices in product design, AI interfaces, and healthcare UX

What You’ll Bring

  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Information Technology, or a related field
  • 0–2 years of experience or strong internship/project portfolio in product or UX/UI design
  • Proficiency in modern design tools (Figma, Sketch, or Adobe XD) and familiarity with prototyping and collaboration workflows
  • Strong visual design sense with attention to typography, spacing, and usability
  • An ability to think from first principles and simplify complex systems into elegant, human-centered experiences
  • Excellent communication skills - able to present design rationale clearly and collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams
  • Curiosity for healthcare, AI, and how design can drive trust, adoption, and change in critical systems
skill_set: Strong internship/project portfolio in product or UX/UI design

job_description:
Company Overview:

Google is not a conventional company, and we don’t intend to become one. True, we share

attributes with the world’s most successful organizations – a focus on innovation and smart

business practices comes to mind – but even as we continue to grow, we’re committed to

retaining a small-company feel. At Google, we know that every employee has something

important to say, and that every employee is integral to our success. We provide

individually-tailored compensation packages that can comprise competitive salary, bonus, and

equity components, along with the opportunity to earn further financial bonuses and rewards.

Googlers thrive in small, focused teams and high-energy environments, believe in the ability of

technology to change the world, and are as passionate about their lives as they are about their

work. For more information, visit www.google.com/careers.

HUE UX Team:

Human Understanding and Experiences (HUE) is the engine of data-informed product creation.

We combine analytical rigor and creative vision to transform complex user data and insights into

effortless and inspiring experiences. Moving beyond metrics, we champion the "real people"

behind our products to understand the unique blend of emotions and needs that drive their

interactions, ensuring our work truly serves humankind.

Role Description:

We follow a simple but vital premise in the User Experience group: "Focus on the user and all

else will follow.

" We're ardently interested in our users and strive to learn everything we can

about their behaviors, attitudes and emotions to help define the products and experiences we

create. The User Experience team is a critical driving force behind gathering these insights and

then using them to inspire and inform design. We are a multi-disciplinary team of interaction

designers, visual designers, UX researchers, UX writers and UX engineers who collaborate

closely with each other and with engineering and product management to create innovative,

usable, great-looking products that people love to use.

A UX Designer envisions how people experience our products and bring that vision to life in a

way that feels inspired, refined and even magical. In this role, you'll learn to tackle complextasks and transform them into intuitive, accessible and easy-to-use solutions for billions of

people around the world - from first time users to sophisticated experts.

Opportunities:

As a UX Intern, you will get a dedicated mentor during your project and be part of a thriving UX

community who will help develop your skills and methods for most of the following areas

●

●

●

●

●

●

●

Collaborate with Designers and Product Managers to gather feedback, explore

solutions and deliver on designs.

Assist in conducting user research and usability testing.

Develop wireframes, mockups, and prototypes.

Contribute to the design of user interfaces and experiences.

Understand and apply UX principles and best practices.

Learn how UX contributes to and collaborates on the product development process.

Learn about and apply typography, color, grid, and composition principles.

Minimum qualifications:

●

Currently enrolled in a B.Des/ M.Des degree in Human-Computer Interaction, Product

Design/ Visual Communication/ Interaction Design or related field, and graduating in

2026

● Must be currently enrolled in a full-time degree program and returning to the program after the completion of the internship.

● A design portfolio that demonstrates strong design principles for web and/or mobile

platforms.

● Demonstrable proficiency with design tools (e.g. Figma, Framer Studio, etc.).

● Experience conducting user interviews or surveys

● Relevant experience in applying user-centered design principles in intern, work or

project setting.

Preferred qualifications:

●verbal and visual.

●fundamentals.

Solid analytical, creative and visual thinker with excellent communication skills, both

Strong design background in interaction and/or graphic design and/or motion designTo apply:

You must submit all of the following materials:

● Updated resume with year of graduation and program (B.Design/M.Design)

● Design portfolio

● Transcript of current or previous semester- unofficial or official; must be in English.

● You are required to be located in India (Bangalore) for the duration of the internship program.

We are hiring across 3 roles in the Hardware Engineering team - the hiring process will be common and the allocations will happen based on interview performance.

Software Development Engineer (SDE)

Summary:

The Software Platform team within Hardware Test Engineering (HWTE) is seeking a Software Design Engineer to design and develop software for Apple’s new product introductions (NPI). This engineer will collaborate closely with other HWTE Software Platform team members and cross-functional teams to ensure the success of current and future Apple products. The HWTE Software Platform team owns various projects, including tools for enabling calibration and testing of NPI products, systems that restore software on each device shipped to customers, and algorithms for image processing for product calibration and testing.

Description:

As part of the Software Platform team, you will be responsible for writing and designing software tools used by algorithm developers and factory station software engineers responsible for implementing test sequences for testing hardware in the factory. You will work closely with system design leads to understand the software needs for factory test stations and develop software solutions and plugins for instruments used on the station to enable hardware testing of Apple products. Additionally, you will be involved in taking the existing implementation of the algorithm in C++ and writing unit tests using XCTest in Xcode. You will also write smoke and regression tests using your knowledge of Lua and Python. You will collaborate closely with algorithm developers to identify parts of the code that require stress testing and apply various methodologies, such as performance testing, integration testing, and fuzz testing. Furthermore, you will leverage machine learning and LLMs to automatically generate tests for complex parts of the software, ensuring robust coverage based on analysis.

Responsibilities:

• Designing new software systems and maintaining existing software systems.

• Triaging and diagnosing issues with a cross-functional team from diverse engineering

backgrounds.

• Working with internal teams at Apple and external vendors to develop better

solutions and processes.

• Collaborating with algorithm developers to support the implementation of new tests.

• Setting up automated testing for continuous integration using the existing internal

infrastructure.

• Hosting and migrating algorithm pipelines on the continuous integration platform.

• Debugging build failures in CI/CT ( Continuous Integration / Continuous Test )

• Adding new features to the test framework to handle new use cases.Minimum Qualifications:

• BS/MS in Computer Science or equivalent experience

• Strong command of C/C++ and an object-oriented language

• Experience with white box testing

• Experience with Xcode and macOS

• Experience with Lua and Python development

• Knowledge of image processing and algorithm design

• Understanding of DSP

Preferred Qualifications:

• Experience with machine learning and LLMs

• Experience with performance analysis, stress tests, and scalability assessments

• Experience with telemetry, critical metrics, and data-driven decision-making

• Experience crafting tests with complex systems and quickly evolving test

environments


Mechanical Systems Design Engineer

The people here at Apple don’t just create products — they create the kind of wonder that’s revolutionized entire industries. It’s the diversity of those people and their ideas that inspires the innovation that runs through everything we do, from amazing technology to industry-leading environmental efforts. Join Apple, and help us leave the world better than we found it. Are you up for the challenge? Apple’s Measurement R&D group is recruiting Mechanical Systems Design Engineers with mechanical and automation design experience, strong communication and technical leadership skills. You will brainstorm, design, develop and characterize metrology equipment used to calibrate and test Apple’s new groundbreaking technology and products. Your design work will range from lab scale systems-- understanding and characterizing tool capability at sub-micron mechanical tolerances, to developing automated mass- production measurement tools, where balancing the engineering tradeoffs between precision, costs, lead-time and throughput is critical. With great diversity of the problem space, you will rely on your engineering background to architect the optimal solution for the problem at hand, leaning on the fundamentals of materials science, structural and thermal analysis, machinery design, automation and manufacturing processes. You will work collaboratively with a creative and diverse team of experienced engineers from all disciplines including instrumentation, core technology, product design and operations teams developing state of the art measurement systems for Apple.

Responsibilities:

- Automated measurement system development and optimization from ideation to

deployment.

- Detailed mechanical design of manual and automated measurement and

calibration systems (including component and materials selection, 3D/2D CAD,

mechanism design, FEA)

- Collaboration with vendors to develop measurement systems and improve

manufacturing and metrology capabilities and processes

- Management of vendor prototyping schedule and manufacturing plan

- Support new product failure analysis and continuous improvements in product

manufacturability and performance, contributing to the production of the highest

quality products available

- Support new vendor development to expand Apple’s vendor base with regards to

capability, capacity, and geographical influence

- Requires up to 25% international travel to support equipment design, deployment,

and validationAbout You:

- You have an engineering background (Mechanical / Aerospace / Mechatronics)

- You’re motivated with the dream and ability to become an integral part of Apple’s

talented, highly creative and dynamic engineering team

- You have excellent English communication and interpersonal skills

- You know 3D CAD modeling systems and workflow

- You can apply GD&T (ASME Y14.5) principles and drafting standards

- You love stress-strain relationships, static mechanics (determinate and

indeterminate systems)

- You get excited about kinematics and mechanism design

Preferred Skills:

- High volume electronics manufacturing equipment design, including structures,

sheet metal, plastics, fixture/mechanism design, robotics, probe design, plating

materials and thermal design is a plus

- UG NX experience preferred

- FEA (stress analysis) highly desirable, ANSYS preferred

- Plastic part design, molded part design highly desirable

- Metal and plastic materials science, tribology and wear principles highly desirable

- Project and product management experience strongly preferred

- Mandarin written and verbal language a plus

Apple is an Equal Opportunity Employer that is committed to inclusion and values

diversity. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin,

gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. We

also take affirmative action to offer employment and advancement opportunities to all

applicants, including minorities, women, protected veterans, and individuals with

disabilities.


Instrumentation System Design Engineer

Job Description

Apple designs consumer electronics that have touched millions and changed the way people interact with electronic devices around the world. The Product Integrity Group plays a key role in keeping up the standards. Through work with the team you will have the unique opportunity to impact products all across Apple, because here new ideas have a way of becoming great products, services, and customer experiences very quickly. We are looking for an engineer to design, develop and deploy calibration and test instrumentation systems for Apple’s world class products. This engineer will work closely with cross-functional groups (Design, ME, EE, SW, Ops, etc.) throughout the New Product Introduction (NPI) phase to ensure the success of current and future Apple products.

Description

You will be responsible for the design specification, bring up, validation and deployment of automated instrumentation to calibrate and test Apple’s products through NPI and mass production.

• Knowledge, coupled with experience in designing calibration and test solutions in motion,

optical, camera and touch sensing technology

• Architect instrumentation systems (including HW specification) and maintain those

systems through production

• Work with our mechanical engineering team to specify and validate the required

mechanical fixtures & automation systems

• Develop, debug, and optimize automation software

• Run simulations/ DOEs to make data driven decisions & presenting to management

• Analyze large amounts of data generated from your instrument systems and adopt data-

driven approaches to solving engineering challenges

• Perform failure mode root cause analysis and resolution, debugging from the system

level down to the component level

• Collaborate with cross functional teams like module design, system EE, product design,

firmware, operations, and logistics teams.

• Frequent interactions with contract manufacturers/vendors; developing SOPs, debug

instructions, and documentation

Minimum Requirements

• Masters/ Bachelors in Robotics/Mechatronics/Electrical/Electronics/Computer

Engineering

• Clear fundamentals on sensors (light/force/pressure/touch/motion) and electro-

mechanical systems and digital communication protocols (USB, UART, I2C, SPI)

• Basic understanding of signal processing though coursework or projects

• Intermediate Programming skills in one or more of the following: C/C++/Python/Matlab

• Strong applied mathematical skills (algorithms, modeling, simulations)

• Self motivated and confident in working independently in a challenging and fast paced

environment

• Excellent written and verbal communication skills

• Domestic and international travel may be required (up to 10%)
